commit_message:
Remove redundant call to API in ShareType.get_keys() method

In most cases ShareType resource already has all needed data,
that's why get_keys() do redundant calls to API.

Change-Id: I280c8919c29a19767d8bc0b5b9c1f217628b7357

commit_message:
Applying event log feature for CDH - part 2

It would be nice to apply event log feature for CDH.
Because it's require big changes it would done in
series of small CRs.

This patch add few applications of event log in configuring
cluster

partially implements bp: event-log

Change-Id: Ib9c8f09d1cb6a59e6f562df2ee84566c71d7e28d

subject: Handle deleting status during volume detachment
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-26 23:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/aws/test_volume.py', 'heat/engine/volume_tasks.py'], 'message': 'Handle deleting status during volume detachment

VolumeAttachment resource is throwing exception during
detachment if the volume is in deleting status. This change
is to skip detachment if the volume is in deleting
status.

Change-Id: I8a7f4f1c95d64c123ea76150cc80a6ef12532e8b
Closes-Bug: #1426053
'}]
commit_message:
Handle deleting status during volume detachment

VolumeAttachment resource is throwing exception during
detachment if the volume is in deleting status. This change
is to skip detachment if the volume is in deleting
status.

Change-Id: I8a7f4f1c95d64c123ea76150cc80a6ef12532e8b
Closes-Bug: #1426053

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-02-10 15:19:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_rpcapi.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Remove port from ovsdb after its deletion

When port is being deleted via API it is not removed
from ovsdb and corresponding iptables chains remain
even though the port does not exist.

This patch adds a notification for the ovs neutron agent,
upon which the port is deleted from ovsdb.

Co-Authored-By: Akash Gangil <akashg1611@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1333365
Change-Id: Iccda3bee98d561ef3a06d0317d3d68d6b1dfb76b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove port from ovsdb after its deletion

When port is being deleted via API it is not removed
from ovsdb and corresponding iptables chains remain
even though the port does not exist.

This patch adds a notification for the ovs neutron agent,
upon which the port is deleted from ovsdb.

Co-Authored-By: Akash Gangil <akashg1611@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1333365
Change-Id: Iccda3bee98d561ef3a06d0317d3d68d6b1dfb76b

subject: Added a global 'region_name' config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-27 00:34:28.000000000', 'files': ['solum/deployer/handlers/heat.py', 'solum/worker/handlers/shell.py', 'solum/common/clients.py', 'solum/api/handlers/assembly_handler.py', 'solum/worker/config.py'], 'message': "Added a global 'region_name' config

Operator just needs to set this global 'region_name' which applies
to all OpenStack clients. Each client is able to override the global
value by setting 'region_name' under its own config section.

Change-Id: I897d7992381526cc655fb88a37ae5e6ed426f11f
"}]
commit_message:
Added a global 'region_name' config

Operator just needs to set this global 'region_name' which applies
to all OpenStack clients. Each client is able to override the global
value by setting 'region_name' under its own config section.

Change-Id: I897d7992381526cc655fb88a37ae5e6ed426f11f

subject: Fix None type in params
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-23 18:24:03.000000000', 'files': ['solum/worker/handlers/shell.py'], 'message': "Fix None type in params

WSME.types.validate_types() allows None type, which means a user
can pass in a parameter like 'FOO:'. But in this case the user will
eventually get 'FOO: None' in his app. This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I73ef3e7dd7f59ce40153d98a8d9cef4b06d1f35c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix None type in params

WSME.types.validate_types() allows None type, which means a user
can pass in a parameter like 'FOO:'. But in this case the user will
eventually get 'FOO: None' in his app. This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I73ef3e7dd7f59ce40153d98a8d9cef4b06d1f35c

subject: Fix PEP8 E121,E122,E123,E124,E125,E129 errors
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-26 16:40:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/shell.py', 'ironicclient/tests/v1/test_driver.py', 'ironicclient/exc.py', 'tox.ini', 'ironicclient/tests/v1/test_node_shell.py'], 'message': "Fix PEP8 E121,E122,E123,E124,E125,E129 errors

E121: continuation line under-indented for hanging indent
E122: continuation line missing indentation or outdented
E123: closing bracket does not match indentation of opening bracket's line
E124: closing bracket does not match visual indentation
E125: continuation line with same indent as next logical line
E129: visually indented line with same indent as next logical line

Remove E121,E122,E123,E124,E125, & E129 from the ignore list for flake8

Change-Id: I1b98335dd24086ab0271d25d662ad667ff8c5835
"}]
commit_message:
Fix PEP8 E121,E122,E123,E124,E125,E129 errors

E121: continuation line under-indented for hanging indent
E122: continuation line missing indentation or outdented
E123: closing bracket does not match indentation of opening bracket's line
E124: closing bracket does not match visual indentation
E125: continuation line with same indent as next logical line
E129: visually indented line with same indent as next logical line

Remove E121,E122,E123,E124,E125, & E129 from the ignore list for flake8

Change-Id: I1b98335dd24086ab0271d25d662ad667ff8c5835

commit_message:
wsgi: remove explicit monkey_patch() call

All module consumers already monkey_patch() stdlib thru dummy entry
points located in neutron/cmd/eventlet/... There is no need to patch it
here.

Change-Id: I8c747f166aeb903ee8e69b3076c447f4fd9bc495

commit_message:
get_or_create_project now calls repo factory

Instead of receiving a model repository instance, the
get_or_create_project function which is called all around the
controllers now uses the repo factory method inside the function.
This removes the need for fetching that repo from most of the
controllers.

Change-Id: I2c3c3b1d56049f801d43f59e86592ac80a48a8c5

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-25 16:43:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_api.py'], 'message': 'WIP: Dell Storage Center: Address GetList failure

For some reason in our API we are seeing occasional
instances where querying for a volume that we know
exists returns an empty result.

While this is being investigated on our side we also
want to address this in our driver in case a customer
would also hit this.

This patch adds a retry to these calls to investigate
this. It has been seen in failing test cases that
querying for the volume again later has been able to
find the volume.

Change-Id: Ic494992bdf4415147eeaccccbe539a99e217cc82
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Dell Storage Center: Address GetList failure

For some reason in our API we are seeing occasional
instances where querying for a volume that we know
exists returns an empty result.

While this is being investigated on our side we also
want to address this in our driver in case a customer
would also hit this.

This patch adds a retry to these calls to investigate
this. It has been seen in failing test cases that
querying for the volume again later has been able to
find the volume.

Change-Id: Ic494992bdf4415147eeaccccbe539a99e217cc82

ironic. This driver exports the following tables with ironic data:
chassises, nodes, node_properties, ports, drivers, active_hosts

Change-Id: I55046d2bd1d483c05a4760343d9a5af30dfb0c94

commit_message:
Add Ironic datasource driver

This patch adds a datasource driver to congress that integrates with
ironic. This driver exports the following tables with ironic data:
chassises, nodes, node_properties, ports, drivers, active_hosts

Implements blueprint: ironic-datasource-driver

Change-Id: I55046d2bd1d483c05a4760343d9a5af30dfb0c94

subject: Properly serialize/deserialize arguments in fake indirection api
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-26 23:21:15.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/fixture.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Properly serialize/deserialize arguments in fake indirection api

The fixture was just serializing and deserializing method arguments
with JSON, but this is not indicative of what actually happens in
a real project (like nova) where arguments can be objects.

Change-Id: I299983a2e345a2b8075038553c6a4dd77d3fd5e8
'}]
commit_message:
Properly serialize/deserialize arguments in fake indirection api

The fixture was just serializing and deserializing method arguments
with JSON, but this is not indicative of what actually happens in
a real project (like nova) where arguments can be objects.

Change-Id: I299983a2e345a2b8075038553c6a4dd77d3fd5e8

commit_message:
Allow passing serializer and indirection API objects to Fixture

This makes it easier to ensure that you're using the same indirection
or serialization routines in tests as you are in production.

Change-Id: I4530ba5781ad81ad4a6b4af466af348551c3c3e4

subject: Make serializer use the provided base class for the indirection api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 23:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Make serializer use the provided base class for the indirection api

This was found when converting nova to use o.vo. If we provide our own
base class (for namespacing reasons) we need the serializer to use it
(as intended) to find the indirection_api.

Change-Id: I480427fe97476e4e20fef453be6bb6ed28ae51ac
'}]
commit_message:
Make serializer use the provided base class for the indirection api

This was found when converting nova to use o.vo. If we provide our own
base class (for namespacing reasons) we need the serializer to use it
(as intended) to find the indirection_api.

Change-Id: I480427fe97476e4e20fef453be6bb6ed28ae51ac

commit_message:
Clean up test inheritance

With the addition of the 'mixin' class to the API tests, I noticed
that almost all of the functional tests in test_resources and also the
tests in test_resources_policy ended up inheriting from the
aforementioned class. So this commit is barely to clean things up,
setting up the classes in such a way that the base classes now inherit
from the 'mixin'.

Change-Id: Ibcaff51d2502a8493cf0235a242324f65081b1c5

subject: Use sudo when manipulating git for image list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-27 02:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-devstack/extra-data.d/55-cache-devstack-repos', 'nodepool/scripts/cache_devstack.py'], 'message': 'Use sudo when manipulating git for image list

When we build our images we attempt to checkout all of the valid
devstack branches so that we can list all of the images necessary to be
cached for each branch. Unfortunately this devstack repo is owned by
root during dib and snapshot image builds. This means we must use sudo
when updating the repo (either changing branches or updating the
current branch).

Change-Id: I8cd09cfed4d586648dcbd34fa04bfc030c31ee45
'}]
commit_message:
Use sudo when manipulating git for image list

When we build our images we attempt to checkout all of the valid
devstack branches so that we can list all of the images necessary to be
cached for each branch. Unfortunately this devstack repo is owned by
root during dib and snapshot image builds. This means we must use sudo
when updating the repo (either changing branches or updating the
current branch).

Change-Id: I8cd09cfed4d586648dcbd34fa04bfc030c31ee45

commit_message:
Add AMT-PXE-Driver Common Library

Introduce a new driver pxe_amt to extend Ironic's range to desktop.
AMT/vPro is widely used in desktop to remotely control the power,
similar like IPMI in server.

It will use amt as power management and pxe as deploy management.
This patch only provide basic operations to support the workflow of
remotely deploy on AMT/vPro system.

This add common library only.

Implements blueprint amt-pxe-driver
Change-Id: I357332a5880bdb6fd801207fb766a24780a657ea

commit_message:
Add AMT-PXE-Driver Power&Management Interface

Introduce a new driver pxe_amt to extend Ironic's range to desktop.
AMT/vPro is widely used in desktop to remotely control the power,
similar like IPMI in server.
It will use amt as power management and pxe as deploy management.
This patch only provide basic operations to support the workflow of
remotely deploy on AMT/vPro system.

This add power and management interface.

Implements blueprint amt-pxe-driver
Change-Id: If249b72509eec586b7b91d985301ed12e53cf25f

subject: Cleanup accessbot and gerritbot
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-27 12:50:11.000000000', 'files': ['accessbot/channels.yaml', 'gerritbot/channels.yaml'], 'message': "Cleanup accessbot and gerritbot

The channels openstack-gbp, openstack-poppy, solum, striker-dev
and surveil were setup in gerritbot but
not in accessbot. I've added them after verifying that openstackinfra
has access.

The channels dragonflow, openstack-distil, openstack-vmtp only had
openstackgerrit in the channel and nobody else. The channels were also
not registered and thus openstackinfra had no access to them. Remove
them. Projects can add them back again after proper setup of the
channels as documented in
http://ci.openstack.org/irc.html#channel-requirements

Change-Id: I7e75f6f5cae89bda48aedf048fb6db780ae7b9c0
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup accessbot and gerritbot

The channels openstack-gbp, openstack-poppy, solum, striker-dev
and surveil were setup in gerritbot but
not in accessbot. I've added them after verifying that openstackinfra
has access.

The channels dragonflow, openstack-distil, openstack-vmtp only had
openstackgerrit in the channel and nobody else. The channels were also
not registered and thus openstackinfra had no access to them. Remove
them. Projects can add them back again after proper setup of the
channels as documented in
http://ci.openstack.org/irc.html#channel-requirements

Change-Id: I7e75f6f5cae89bda48aedf048fb6db780ae7b9c0

commit_message:
add bash completion script

This patch add a script mistral.bash_completion which enables
auto-completion of mistral CLI in bash environmnet when running:

python setup.py install
or
python setup.py develop

test:
mistral [tab][tab]
mistral workf[tab][tab]
mistral workflow-get -[tab][tab]

Change-Id: I8e25f3a90c09e6f09877d9f66cc1f8aa44d6e6f6
Implements: blueprint add-bash-completion-script

commit_message:
Refactor Secrets resource to use repository factories

Instead of passing around the repositories in the constructor of the
controller classes, now a factory function is called. The necessary
functions were added in order to mock these factory calls.

The Repository class was left as is, as the objects that use it will
be refactored in subsequent commits.

subject: Add error state transition for creation of domains
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-25 22:07:29.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_pool_manager/test_service_memcache.py', 'designate/tests/test_pool_manager/test_service_noop.py', 'designate/pool_manager/cache/impl_sqlalchemy/__init__.py', 'designate/pool_manager/service.py', 'designate/tests/test_pool_manager/test_service_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': "Add error state transition for creation of domains

* If a domain creation is not successful on the backend
servers, then the domain transitions to an error state.
* Rewrote _clear_cache to skip an explicit retrieve.
For memcache no retrieve is necessary. So no additional
action is needed.
For sqlalchemy, an id is needed for a delete, so a retrieve
is done on a clear if needed.
* periodic_sync now sync's domains that are not in an
error state (periodic_recovery handles domains that are
in error)
* Added/modified unit tests

Change-Id: I375262b3ccf4d1d9da1c8954f4768a55955a0129
Closes-Bug: 1413800
Closes-Bug: 1425695
"}]
commit_message:
Add error state transition for creation of domains

* If a domain creation is not successful on the backend
servers, then the domain transitions to an error state.
* Rewrote _clear_cache to skip an explicit retrieve.
For memcache no retrieve is necessary. So no additional
action is needed.
For sqlalchemy, an id is needed for a delete, so a retrieve
is done on a clear if needed.
* periodic_sync now sync's domains that are not in an
error state (periodic_recovery handles domains that are
in error)
* Added/modified unit tests

Change-Id: I375262b3ccf4d1d9da1c8954f4768a55955a0129
Closes-Bug: 1413800
Closes-Bug: 1425695

subject: Make extra spec driver_handles_share_servers required
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-02-27 12:41:16.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/tests/unit/v1/test_types.py', 'manilaclient/tests/unit/v1/fakes.py', 'manilaclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/v1/share_types.py', 'manilaclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Make extra spec driver_handles_share_servers required

Currently, the driver_handles_share_servers is an optional extra_spec
on each share_type that allows the scheduler to filter. We want to
make this a required extra spec, so that every share type has this
value set to true or false. It's not be possible to remove that extra
spec. Modifying the extra spec is allowed as long as the value
remains either true or false.

- Add required argument "spec_driver_handles_share_servers" to
"type_create" command
- Add column "required_extra_specs" to columns printed by command
"type-list"
- Change title of column "extra_specs" to "all_extra_specs" in
"extra-specs-list" command
- Add appropriate unit tests

Partially implements bp share-type-require-driver-mode

Change-Id: I9bd3855e8a51159cf5ccc282bcbef688f7268e5e
'}]
commit_message:
Make extra spec driver_handles_share_servers required

Currently, the driver_handles_share_servers is an optional extra_spec
on each share_type that allows the scheduler to filter. We want to
make this a required extra spec, so that every share type has this
value set to true or false. It's not be possible to remove that extra
spec. Modifying the extra spec is allowed as long as the value
remains either true or false.

- Add required argument "spec_driver_handles_share_servers" to
"type_create" command
- Add column "required_extra_specs" to columns printed by command
"type-list"
- Change title of column "extra_specs" to "all_extra_specs" in
"extra-specs-list" command
- Add appropriate unit tests

Partially implements bp share-type-require-driver-mode

Change-Id: I9bd3855e8a51159cf5ccc282bcbef688f7268e5e

commit_message:

Firefox 36 was just released on trusty and precise, this version
is incompatible with any released version of selenium. Until a

Firefox 36, making selenium jobs for horizon non-voting.

commit_message:
Refactor Orders resource to use repository factories

Instead of passing around the repositories in the constructor of the
controller classes, now a factory function is called.

A Mixin class was added in the tests in order to patch the
aforementioned factory functions. Though, only the functions related
to the Orders resource were added to this Mixin class.

Change-Id: Ibf468f09e6837cb8658cfcd164f4f766997c132a

The wheel published on PyPI is broken and causes
failures in various dsvm jobs we run.

Rackspace's mirror has fixed their version by
removing the tests and egg info (see
http://rpc-slushee.rackspace.com/python_packages/pools/
to compare their "fixed" wheel and the wheel on
PyPI), so either we need to do that or exclude it

commit_message:
Exclude Routes 2.1

The wheel published on PyPI is broken and causes
failures in various dsvm jobs we run.

Rackspace's mirror has fixed their version by
removing the tests and egg info (see
http://rpc-slushee.rackspace.com/python_packages/pools/
to compare their "fixed" wheel and the wheel on
PyPI), so either we need to do that or exclude it
as we did last time in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103991/

Change-Id: I51a807001c47c3a6ab747db94a969b50a8d5691c

commit_message:
API: Change the API cpu_info to be meaning ful.

Currently the API sample get '?' for the cpu_info, this is really
confusing, it even does not tell the type of the return.

Change it to be more meaningful.

Change-Id: I791beb7502f47dff646a46c08e818c29f9e6cd79

commit_message:
Require config before running dbsync

Need to have a backend set in the config file before we can run the db
sync.  Better to just wait for all config options to be in place before
running db sync to be safe.

Change-Id: Ibff46f878eed58cad6a9b2c04334203dc4604e4a

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-12 09:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_service/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_endpoint/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_role/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_tenant/openstack.rb'], 'message': "Fix prefetch refresh for providers

The instance method for most providers did only gather the instance
during the first execution. After that, it was cached and never
refreshed, which broke cases like creating a tenant and then trying
to fetch that tenant's id for other usage.

Change-Id: I5a9767383438549e354429632f8c1a7e569aa8fb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix prefetch refresh for providers

The instance method for most providers did only gather the instance
during the first execution. After that, it was cached and never
refreshed, which broke cases like creating a tenant and then trying
to fetch that tenant's id for other usage.

Change-Id: I5a9767383438549e354429632f8c1a7e569aa8fb

The datastore parameter for configuration-create is documented as
optional but is required if there is no default datastore. Changed

Closes-bug 1365702

Change-Id: I30d3a38d324d32be5be0f6fed81f2d2daa3ef2e6

commit_message:
Changed error message for datastore parameter for configuration-create

The datastore parameter for configuration-create is documented as
optional but is required if there is no default datastore. Changed
the error message to handle this case.

Closes-bug 1365702

Change-Id: I30d3a38d324d32be5be0f6fed81f2d2daa3ef2e6

commit_message:
Sync middleware module from oslo-incubator

Since the last merge of the middleware module
there has been a change to middleware to move
to the new oslo_middleware namespace.  This patch
pulls those changes in so we no longer get a warning
during pep8 testing.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit 9bf01f9d98487cb13e3d95ad2a580fe8fc6f2479
Date:  Fri Feb 13 14:18:58 2015 -0500
Switch from oslo.config to oslo_config

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------
a01a8527 Use oslo_middleware instead of deprecated oslo.middleware
66d8d613 Fix oslo.middleware deprecation error

Change-Id: Ife236b175f941e93886f17989eb0cb96c031db8c

commit_message:
Migrate to oslo.log

This is just a matter of switching import paths and adding appropriate

commit_message:
Remove nsenter docker image

nsenter via docker container was never properly
implemented for docker with native exec driver.
It can be safely removed.

blueprint fuel-master-docker-upgrade

Change-Id: I5286c60530ea422527024fc099fe877c3962165b
(cherry picked from commit 2ba3e9eeb4a21f455a6acef4eb2060ba333b137c)

commit_message:
Add unit tests for nova.virt.firewall.IpTablesFirewallDriver

Jay Pipes filed bug 1295889 to create full unit tests for
the base firewall driver, and this patch contains a start of
those unit tests.

These tests are from abandoned Jay's patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/82379/

With the K2K Service Catalog must be extended with a list of available
service providers. Such object should be added only if federation
extension is enabled and list of accessible service providers is

Partially-Implements: bp k2k-service-providers

commit_message:
Add ``service_providers`` in Service Catalog

With the K2K Service Catalog must be extended with a list of available
service providers. Such object should be added only if federation
extension is enabled and list of accessible service providers is
non-empty.

Change-Id: If71ecb738360669e20d17cb757ad86a531ccae98
Partially-Implements: bp k2k-service-providers

continue working while a build is is progress, which can be very long
in the case of build-all-docker-images.

Pre-defined OpenStack workloads resources (flavors) mark as removed
on cluster reset. As result we have duplication of resources in
'current' and 'removed'.

Closes-Bug: #1426279
Change-Id: I1fcd8dbdc9243b141631df696b9595873e7dc4ab

commit_message:
Fix for pre-defined workloads stats status

Pre-defined OpenStack workloads resources (flavors) mark as removed
on cluster reset. As result we have duplication of resources in
'current' and 'removed'.

Closes-Bug: #1426279
Change-Id: I1fcd8dbdc9243b141631df696b9595873e7dc4ab

commit_message:
made action value translatable in firewall rules table

In firewall rules table, the value of action column
is not translatable

In this patch, it is adding display choices tuple
with translatable option.

Change-Id: Id06511bd4ed0319e58bda69e5b3aebd29cd4880c
Closes-Bug: #1424557

- transform vCenter radiobutton to checkbox, if a user ticked a checkbox
  then only nova-network becomes available as network manager on
  "Network" step
- also if checkbox was ticked flag 'use_vcenter' is set to true, we no
  longer rely on fact that variable 'libvirt_type' will get value
  'vcenter'

  and Ceph for Cinder and Glance at the "Storage" step of cluster

DocImpact

Change-Id: I38411ae93ff9d3d3fef0b58f27561023e5a9495a
'}]
commit_message:
Change vCenter workflow in the cluster creation wizard

- transform vCenter radiobutton to checkbox, if a user ticked a checkbox
  then only nova-network becomes available as network manager on
  "Network" step
- also if checkbox was ticked flag 'use_vcenter' is set to true, we no
  longer rely on fact that variable 'libvirt_type' will get value
  'vcenter'
- if vCenter was enabled user is able to choose between default backend
  and Ceph for Cinder and Glance at the "Storage" step of cluster
  creation wizard
- remove VMware vCenter option on "Storage" step for both Cinder and
  Glance, in order to enable Cinder VMDK backend user must assign
  special role "cinder-vmdk"
- remove vCenter related messages from translations file that are no
  longer needed

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint vmware-dual-hypervisor
Change-Id: I38411ae93ff9d3d3fef0b58f27561023e5a9495a

subject: Make functests retry auth immediately
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 20:39:21.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/__init__.py'], 'message': "Make functests retry auth immediately

I don't think we need to backoff after a 401 - we have a perfectly valid
response telling us exactly what we should do so we can do that right away and
move on.

Assuming you run functional tests at least once a day, according to
http://xkcd.com/1205/ and my benchmarks you can spend roughly a full day
reviewing this change and still come out ahead.

Change-Id: I27c42c4ee3254eb32aad4d3dac08b16b3a43d611
"}]
commit_message:
Make functests retry auth immediately

I don't think we need to backoff after a 401 - we have a perfectly valid
response telling us exactly what we should do so we can do that right away and
move on.

Assuming you run functional tests at least once a day, according to
http://xkcd.com/1205/ and my benchmarks you can spend roughly a full day
reviewing this change and still come out ahead.

Change-Id: I27c42c4ee3254eb32aad4d3dac08b16b3a43d611

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-24 16:36:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_flavor_manage.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/client.py'], 'message': "enhance flavor manage functional tests

Enhance the flavor manage functional tests to nearly cover what's done
in the equivalent Tempest tests (especially the negative
tests). Specifically we add tests for deleted flavor handling, and
bounds checking of various parameters.

The remaining missing negative tests are related to authorization
testing, which requires more changes to the OSAPIFixture
infrastructure.

A change to the APIClient api_request interface is made to push the
body encoding work into the method. The APIClient wasn't built with
negative testing in mind, so this is a temporary move until we've got
enough tests in play to refactor the interface to be easier to use in
these cases.

Change-Id: I1bf2bb6194f2d2e56ed7289100c077416acb0f58
"}]
commit_message:
enhance flavor manage functional tests

Enhance the flavor manage functional tests to nearly cover what's done
in the equivalent Tempest tests (especially the negative
tests). Specifically we add tests for deleted flavor handling, and
bounds checking of various parameters.

The remaining missing negative tests are related to authorization
testing, which requires more changes to the OSAPIFixture
infrastructure.

A change to the APIClient api_request interface is made to push the
body encoding work into the method. The APIClient wasn't built with
negative testing in mind, so this is a temporary move until we've got
enough tests in play to refactor the interface to be easier to use in
these cases.

Change-Id: I1bf2bb6194f2d2e56ed7289100c077416acb0f58

subject: Add get_datastore_by_ref method to oslo.vmware
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-26 20:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/vim_util.py', 'oslo_vmware/objects/datastore.py', 'tests/test_vim_util.py', 'tests/objects/test_datastore.py'], 'message': 'Add get_datastore_by_ref method to oslo.vmware

Two methods are added as part of this patch:-

1. get_datastore_by_ref - returns a Datastore object given a
datastore reference.

2. get_object_properties_dict - a vim utility method to retrieve
properties of an object as a dictionary.

Currently, Glance needs these methods to find datastore
objects from datastore references.

Change-Id: I516536ea4098357540531105b4f97e6668fb3f08
'}]
commit_message:
Add get_datastore_by_ref method to oslo.vmware

Two methods are added as part of this patch:-

1. get_datastore_by_ref - returns a Datastore object given a
datastore reference.

2. get_object_properties_dict - a vim utility method to retrieve
properties of an object as a dictionary.

Currently, Glance needs these methods to find datastore
objects from datastore references.

Change-Id: I516536ea4098357540531105b4f97e6668fb3f08

commit_message:
Add vCenter OSTF test manager

- vCenterTest class is derived from NovaNetworkScenarioTest, all checks
  that we are doing against vCenter are identical to checks that we run
  against KVM/QEMU compute nodes (list flavors, create instance, create
  volume, check connectivity, etc)
- we use special cirros image (.vmdk container type) for vCenter sanity
  tests

Change-Id: I7841e96080d8ab81d7d9feed3f4ec77c8600d8b2
Implements: blueprint vmware-dual-hypervisor

Fixes the method _mark_method_skipped because it seems that under
certain conditions nose is unable to recognize SkipTest exception and marks
the test with Error instead of Skip. This should be fixed by using
TestSkipped exception from testtools, which cleverly imports
correct SkipException.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1425660

Change-Id: Iccf0c2190fbb9faa68f9632841e1d9435e1bde75
'}]
commit_message:
Fix skip decorator in integration tests

Fixes the method _mark_method_skipped because it seems that under
certain conditions nose is unable to recognize SkipTest exception and marks
the test with Error instead of Skip. This should be fixed by using
TestSkipped exception from testtools, which cleverly imports
correct SkipException.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1425660

Change-Id: Iccf0c2190fbb9faa68f9632841e1d9435e1bde75

subject: Create new config for pecan debug mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 19:45:01.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/config.py', 'ironic/api/app.py'], 'message': "Create new config for pecan debug mode

Pecan's debug mode can be terribly insecure; 500 errors return a
Python traceback, the full list of environment variables, and a
button to replay the request with a breakpoint.

Deployers often run OpenStack services in debug mode; doing so should
not open the service up to these flaws. However, it may be useful
to use Pecan's debug mode in development, so create a config option
to enable it, rather than disable it altogether.

Change-Id: I5bc76b4101c563cdc168d2e55db060c1bdd0b5fe
Closes-Bug: #1425206
"}]
commit_message:
Create new config for pecan debug mode

Pecan's debug mode can be terribly insecure; 500 errors return a
Python traceback, the full list of environment variables, and a
button to replay the request with a breakpoint.

Deployers often run OpenStack services in debug mode; doing so should
not open the service up to these flaws. However, it may be useful
to use Pecan's debug mode in development, so create a config option
to enable it, rather than disable it altogether.

Change-Id: I5bc76b4101c563cdc168d2e55db060c1bdd0b5fe
Closes-Bug: #1425206

subject: Add tempauth back to /info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 19:48:52.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempauth.py', 'swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py'], 'message': 'Add tempauth back to /info

Our functional tests are skipping Account ACL tests when using tempauth
because it does not register itself with in swift.common.utils._swift_info

Add the register_swift_info call back to the filter_factory function in the
tempauth from which it was removed, and add a test to validate creating the
filter will add the middleware to global info dict.

Change-Id: I3761da3241601c93245796beb5d29bf3f36d69f6
'}]
commit_message:
Add tempauth back to /info

Our functional tests are skipping Account ACL tests when using tempauth
because it does not register itself with in swift.common.utils._swift_info

Add the register_swift_info call back to the filter_factory function in the
tempauth from which it was removed, and add a test to validate creating the
filter will add the middleware to global info dict.

Change-Id: I3761da3241601c93245796beb5d29bf3f36d69f6

commit_message:
test_l2population: Use a fake mech driver instead of ofagent

As ofagent mech driver is subject to be moved out of neutron tree
for vendor code decomposition, use a fake mech driver for UTs
instead.

An alternative to remove the relevant test cases was considered.
But it's still nice to have test cases involving multiple drivers.

Anyway using fake drivers rather than real ones for UTs like this
is a good thing.

Partial-Bug: #1412653
Related: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition
Change-Id: I4b0d344da9ccbda79482f64535396fcc1a495d0f

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-10-23 16:04:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_endpoints.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/v3/client_fixtures.py', 'keystoneclient/service_catalog.py'], 'message': 'Endpoint selection logic fix

In V3 endpoint groups from different regions are not grouped.
It results in a problem in "url_for":
it only stores for result endpoints of the last region
of all with similar service type.

Solution is to accumulate endpoints of services by the same type.

Closes-Bug: #1377080

Change-Id: Ib3ed7f3b496ec32b75171975f0983618acd164e2
'}]
commit_message:
Endpoint selection logic fix

In V3 endpoint groups from different regions are not grouped.
It results in a problem in "url_for":
it only stores for result endpoints of the last region
of all with similar service type.

Solution is to accumulate endpoints of services by the same type.

Closes-Bug: #1377080

Change-Id: Ib3ed7f3b496ec32b75171975f0983618acd164e2

This system helps Neutron entities to cooperate in a loose manner.

This is especially important in face of the advanced service split, where each
service gets to live independently from the core. This is also useful to clean
up some of the tight coupling between ML2 and L3, or L3 and VPN/FW.

This work was touted to be part of the effort on the v3 plugin API design.
(aka perestroika), however that is not going to bear the expected fruits
in time for the Kilo release. This framework is instead pretty crucial to
cleaning up the split between the various Neutron components and some of

Subsequent patches will show how this framework is put into practice in relation

how-to is added in the context of this patch to further clarify how the proposed
mechanism works and can be used.

Related-blueprint: services-split
Related-blueprint: plugin-interface-perestroika

Change-Id: I498aeb0773822707e82763f1f0022c580308bde0
'}]
commit_message:
Add callbacks-based system to Neutron

This system helps Neutron entities to cooperate in a loose manner.

This is especially important in face of the advanced service split, where each
service gets to live independently from the core. This is also useful to clean
up some of the tight coupling between ML2 and L3, or L3 and VPN/FW.

This work was touted to be part of the effort on the v3 plugin API design.
(aka perestroika), however that is not going to bear the expected fruits
in time for the Kilo release. This framework is instead pretty crucial to
cleaning up the split between the various Neutron components and some of
the coupling between ML2 and DVR.

Subsequent patches will show how this framework is put into practice in relation
to cleaning up/decoupling the various Neutron components, however, a devref
how-to is added in the context of this patch to further clarify how the proposed
mechanism works and can be used.

Related-blueprint: services-split
Related-blueprint: plugin-interface-perestroika

Change-Id: I498aeb0773822707e82763f1f0022c580308bde0

commit_message:
Applying event log feature for CDH - part 1

It would be nice to apply event log feature for CDH.
Because it's require big changes it would done in
series of small CRs.

This part introduces refactoring, which is required
for applying event log feature. Also, we apply event
log in few places, where it was very easy.

partially implements bp event-log

Change-Id: I4fd2962702d95fef51a8deeda4448dab7294cd87

commit_message:
create a developer section and refactor

- remove contributing folder contents
   - move plugins into first level
   - keep testing info from 'working with source' and move to first
     level
   - keep a generic contributing page to point to gerrit workflow and
     standard links (git repo, launchpad, etc...)
   - delete everything else
- split TOC into:
   - overview - general stuff
   - developer - dev related stuff
   - appendix - random stuff

Change-Id: I8c460a655427141eb8bb8db9d4c2ecd253eb6cb1

commit_message:
Add stack_tag table and remove stack.tags column

Storing the stack tags in their own table is necessary to allow stack
filtering at the database level.  The stack.tags database column was
unused, so it can be removed without a script to migrate data.

blueprint stack-tags

Change-Id: I5a7e3a30f87b5cc5a60d43ed9efde4ec5bfba9f2

commit_message:
Sync scheduler.filters module from oslo-incubator

The scheduler.filters module hasn't been updated since
January of 2014.  As a result there are a number of changes
that we should pull into Cinder's copy.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit e589dde0721a0a67e4030813e582afec6e70d042
Date:  Wed Feb 18 03:08:12 2015 +0000
Merge "Have a little fun with release notes"

Changes merged with this patch by file:

__init__.py
- be81d6ba - Cleanup unused log related code

availability_zone_filter.py
- 4a47188e -  Allow filters to only run once per request if their data is static

capabilities_filter.py
- 2fbf5065 - Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
- dacc065a - Merge "Update oslo log messages with translation domains"
- 86707cd5 - Remove None for dict.get()
- fcf517d7 - Update oslo log messages with translation domains

extra_specs_ops.py
- ac17de97 - Use oslo_utils instead of deprecated oslo.utils
- 6ff6b4b4 - Switch oslo-incubator to use oslo.utils and remove old modules

ignore_attempted_hosts_filter.py
- 2fbf5065 - Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
- 39625e18 - Set pbr 'warnerrors' option for doc build
- dacc065a - Merge "Update oslo log messages with translation domains"
- 86707cd5 - Remove None for dict.get()
- fcf517d7 - Update oslo log messages with translation domains

json_filter
- 262279b1 - switch to oslo_serialization
- 6c706c5c - Delete graduated serialization files

commit_message:
add bash completion script

This patch add a script mistral.bash_completion which enables
auto-completion of mistral CLI in bash environmnet when running:

python setup.py install
or
python setup.py develop

test:
mistral [tab][tab]
mistral workf[tab][tab]
mistral workflow-get -[tab][tab]

Change-Id: I4e7341d2db7b056225e4610811487025462f58a5
Implements: blueprint add-bash-completion-script

commit_message:
Defect fixed for l2 gateway DB implementation

1. Handled for multiple devices and interfaces
2. handled for multiple segmentation id
3. segmentation id validation handled
4. handled for multi segmentation network
5. handled for connection create for multiple networks with same l2gateway
6. Fixed defect during l2gateway delete check for connection exists
7. update l2 gateway when invalid device name given
8. update l2 gateway for multiple devices

Change-Id: I283449c417b82322e85e37f5c23f06c5618a0ab7

commit_message:
Delete nano flavor creation in each test

* Leave flavor creation only in tests check flavor
* add method find_micro_flavor to use it,
  when create instance
* add additional verification for flavor
  id in check_flavor

revisions:

In case if controller is online, but connectivity
on it is broken we receive false positive

* Import of keystoneclient was added into config.py
* find_proxy method was added
* set proxy changed

commit_message:
Add verification if proxy works

In case if controller is online, but connectivity
on it is broken we receive false positive
message like "Can not set proxy". To fix this:
* Import of keystoneclient was added into config.py
* find_proxy method was added
* set proxy changed

Change-Id: I77d3c0ec12bc071a7e490ddb3ea24cd2f7fea543
Closes-Bug: #1355897

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-25 14:28:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/ds_util.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/host.py'], 'message': 'VMWare: Fix issue for incorrect disk resource report

Reporting host status of vcenter driver now picks up only a single
datastore for disk calculations. This is incorrect if the compute cluster
can access multiple datastores. This fix will consider all available and
accessible datastores for disk report.

Co-authored-by: Zhu Zhu <zhuzhubj@cn.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Ie3e5b91b23a8a09cfca3dbb1e06de625d3b9d829
Closes-Bug: #1347039
'}]
commit_message:
VMWare: Fix issue for incorrect disk resource report

Reporting host status of vcenter driver now picks up only a single
datastore for disk calculations. This is incorrect if the compute cluster
can access multiple datastores. This fix will consider all available and
accessible datastores for disk report.

Co-authored-by: Zhu Zhu <zhuzhubj@cn.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Ie3e5b91b23a8a09cfca3dbb1e06de625d3b9d829
Closes-Bug: #1347039

commit_message:
Fix for wrong validation of 'reboot' task

User got message about wrong action for fuel package 2.0.0
that must support such action

File 'reboot_plugin/tasks.yaml', 'reboot' is not one of ['puppet', 'shell'], value path '1
-> type'

Implements blueprint reboot-action-for-plugin

Change-Id: I52b8e3a2ff0e0b91f23037dbbe59003e402ca88b

commit_message:
Add support for a new datastore(CouchDB) in Trove

This is to add a new CouchDB plugin for Trove in addition to the
existing NoSQL datastores supported currently. The guestagent for
this will include some of the basic functions like create/delete/
list databases and users as well as create and restore backups.

Change-Id: Ie828f3aac448de0adc1cef1698e7026f38133e6e
Implements: blueprint couchdb-plugin-trove

commit_message:
Correct db functional tests to support oslo.db 1.50

Currently test_migrations[1] uses _cleanup private method defined in
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_migrations which has been removed in oslo.db
1.5.0. This change corrects test_migrations[1] based on oslo.db
change I16bfa3af0e1ad6a9231ea38dea7cd76092347f55.

[1] neutron.tests.functional.db package

Change-Id: I35676ca2e5900d7fd95a11d6c7dd3ad1c9a686e2
Closes-Bug: #1425890

commit_message:
Add sahara image constraint

Sahara uses images with specific tags. These images should be registered
in Sahara, otherwise you will get error during creation.
This patch adds constraint for sahara images.

Change-Id: Idce140ca65cd396cd1febcc052898717d378f88d

subject: Set secure Ciphers and MACs for ssh server
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 14495, 'name': 'Adam Heczko', 'email': 'aheczko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aheczko-mirantis'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-26 08:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/preseed/ubuntu-1204.preseed.erb', 'deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/kickstart/centos.ks.erb', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/templates/sshd_config.erb', 'deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/snippets/sshd_secure_ciphers_macs.erb'], 'message': 'Set secure Ciphers and MACs for ssh server

Default configuration of sshd daemon on CentOS and Ubuntu server has
enabled ciphers and MACs which are considered as insecure. We can
explicit define list of ciphers without those which use CBC mode,
and not use old hmac algorithms.

Change-Id: I0d81e35679ce3df2283e31bb928f50dfc6a64615
Closes-Bug: 1408595
'}]
commit_message:
Set secure Ciphers and MACs for ssh server

Default configuration of sshd daemon on CentOS and Ubuntu server has
enabled ciphers and MACs which are considered as insecure. We can
explicit define list of ciphers without those which use CBC mode,
and not use old hmac algorithms.

Change-Id: I0d81e35679ce3df2283e31bb928f50dfc6a64615
Closes-Bug: 1408595

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-27 03:59:48.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/events.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_event_scenarios.py'], 'message': "use default trait type in event list query

Currently, if we request event list api with trait queries, but unset
trait type or set it to '', then we will get 500 and database backend
will fail with KeyError. That is because we use query.type as trait
type, the query.type is checked only when it is set to bool(type) == True,
otherwise, we treat it as string value, but remain type itself unset.

This patch adds a simple check for it, and set it to default type string
when the type is unset or empty.

Change-Id: I503c35cdbc5c8d51dd9b19a314af64ef9fcecf29
Closes-Bug: #1407374
"}]
commit_message:
use default trait type in event list query

Currently, if we request event list api with trait queries, but unset
trait type or set it to '', then we will get 500 and database backend
will fail with KeyError. That is because we use query.type as trait
type, the query.type is checked only when it is set to bool(type) == True,
otherwise, we treat it as string value, but remain type itself unset.

This patch adds a simple check for it, and set it to default type string
when the type is unset or empty.

Change-Id: I503c35cdbc5c8d51dd9b19a314af64ef9fcecf29
Closes-Bug: #1407374

commit_message:
Set apache servername to public VIP address

Nessus security scanner has detected a HTTP
daemon security vulnerability on the CIC node.
It is now possible to gather internal IP
addressing scheme and internal network layout
from the HTTP response headres.

Vulnerabilities reported by Nessus:
10759 - Web Server HTTP Header Internal IP
        Disclosure

Change-Id: I94d5771560520f245ffdf150495d7870cde1b6b0
Closes-Bug: 1408604

commit_message:
Change max_over_subscription_ratio default value

Currently max_over_subscription_ratio is set to 2.0 by default.
This default value is too low for thin provisioning. Change it to 20.0.

Change-Id: I61147e53caa272be0c970507114f5e2b8494edca

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-24 17:40:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/utils.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/throttling.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume_throttling.py', 'cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume_utils.py'], 'message': "Limit volume copy bandwidth per backend

Currently, by setting volume_copy_bps_limit in cinder.conf,
volume/image copy can be throttled to mitigate slow down of
instances' volume access during the copy. However, this is a global
setting and applied to all the backends.
This change enables admins to configure volume_copy_bps_limit to
different values among backends by specifying it in each backend
section.

In addition, with this change, the bps limit will be divided when
multiple volume copy operations run concurrently on the same backend.
For example, if volume_copy_bps_limit is set to 100MB/s, and 2 copies
are running on a backend, each copy can use up to 50MB/s.
This behavior will be useful for QoS which ensures a certain amount
of bandwidth is kept for instances' volume access.

This introduces Throttle classes to count volume copies in a backend
and setup bandwidth limit.

Change-Id: Ie390b46538556fa704b06ffc79cd6cc000bd5936
Implents: blueprint limit-volume-copy-bps-per-backend
"}]
commit_message:
Limit volume copy bandwidth per backend

Currently, by setting volume_copy_bps_limit in cinder.conf,
volume/image copy can be throttled to mitigate slow down of
instances' volume access during the copy. However, this is a global
setting and applied to all the backends.
This change enables admins to configure volume_copy_bps_limit to
different values among backends by specifying it in each backend
section.

In addition, with this change, the bps limit will be divided when
multiple volume copy operations run concurrently on the same backend.
For example, if volume_copy_bps_limit is set to 100MB/s, and 2 copies
are running on a backend, each copy can use up to 50MB/s.
This behavior will be useful for QoS which ensures a certain amount
of bandwidth is kept for instances' volume access.

This introduces Throttle classes to count volume copies in a backend
and setup bandwidth limit.

Change-Id: Ie390b46538556fa704b06ffc79cd6cc000bd5936
Implents: blueprint limit-volume-copy-bps-per-backend

the code.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 22:37:36.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/endpoint_filter/migrate_repo/versions/002_add_endpoint_groups.py'], 'message': "Fix the syntax issue on creating table `endpoint_group`

Migration of `endpoint_filter` to version 2 will fail when the backend
DB is MYSQL instead of SQLite, `primary_key` need to be explicitly specified
in order to setup the ForeignKey relationship between two tables.

Current testcase `keystone.tests.test_sql_migrate_extensions.
EndpointFilterExtension.test_upgrade` can pass the verification since SQLite
don't check this when emitting CREATE statements for tables.

(cherry picked from commit 676457bdca63260ecf675848e34cb01e34822051)

Closes-Bug: #1399768
Change-Id: I82b3fddb921c7c2d2fdecf8add981da37f5319f7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the syntax issue on creating table `endpoint_group`

Migration of `endpoint_filter` to version 2 will fail when the backend
DB is MYSQL instead of SQLite, `primary_key` need to be explicitly specified
in order to setup the ForeignKey relationship between two tables.

Current testcase `keystone.tests.test_sql_migrate_extensions.
EndpointFilterExtension.test_upgrade` can pass the verification since SQLite
don't check this when emitting CREATE statements for tables.

(cherry picked from commit 676457bdca63260ecf675848e34cb01e34822051)

Closes-Bug: #1399768
Change-Id: I82b3fddb921c7c2d2fdecf8add981da37f5319f7

commit_message:
assign cisco network profile to multiple tenants

Add the ability to assign cisco network profile to multiple tenants during network
profile creation and network profile update.
The project field in Create Network Profile and Update Network Profile will be changed
from char field to multiple selection checkbox field, and the name will be changed to
projects

Change-Id: I6ef43bad09f82112c941e1954734f7d11caa0fc9
Implements: blueprint cisco-network-profile-multi-tenants-support

commit_message:
Automatically generated cinder_backups_swift table

This patch adds support for Swift auth 2.0 to the
 cinder-backup Swift driver.
The options had the category "swift" instead of
 "backups_swift".
The category was fixed and the tables were regenerated
 and added to the patch.

Change-Id: I050f46a2b62b3df291a1373fc95d86ac06dbdd47
Closes-Bug: #1355475

commit_message:
Skip failing tests if simplejson speedups extension is missing

On some distributions the default python-simplejson package is installed without
the C speedup extension. This leads to failing tests, thus these tests are now
skipped and an SkipTest exception with an appropriate error message is raised.

Change-Id: I0046eab43f7e82d8d82311efa83c90ea1a083be7
Closes-Bug: 1425776

If the default availability zone is replaced with the
newly-created one, then it causes the info of availability

of launching new VM instance.

This bug fix will not work if the availability zone is not

commit_message:
Fix the inconsistent info of availability zone

If the default availability zone is replaced with the
newly-created one, then it causes the info of availability
zone to be inconsistent for every retrieval in the process
of launching new VM instance.

This bug fix will not work if the availability zone is not
specified (e.g. via CLI of nova boot).

Change-Id: Iee56b1bf8fd5359b76aae8c7625ec1caab7eb5f8
Closes-Bug: #1390033

subject: Show current/all steps at the 'Add App' Wizard's header
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-13 19:25:37.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/templates/services/_wizard_create.html', 'muranodashboard/static/muranodashboard/css/catalog.css', 'muranodashboard/templates/common/_modal_form.html', 'muranodashboard/catalog/views.py', 'muranodashboard/dynamic_ui/services.py'], 'message': 'Show current/all steps at the 'Add App' Wizard's header

Show past steps with green italic, current one with bold blue and next
steps with regular font color.

At first step names are tried to extract from dynamic UI, the field
'name' on the same level as form's 'fields' field, and if none is
present default 'Step ' + current 1-based step index is
used. Management form is given "What's next?" name.

Change-Id: I4145b3ba5e76725d30ac59f2068446aa3f0c834b
'}]
commit_message:
Show current/all steps at the 'Add App' Wizard's header

Show past steps with green italic, current one with bold blue and next
steps with regular font color.

At first step names are tried to extract from dynamic UI, the field
'name' on the same level as form's 'fields' field, and if none is
present default 'Step ' + current 1-based step index is
used. Management form is given "What's next?" name.

Change-Id: I4145b3ba5e76725d30ac59f2068446aa3f0c834b

commit_message:
Implementation for cluster update

    This patch is adding cluster/node update functionality to the
    cluster create flow.

    * Get VM status task
    * Get RabbitMQ status task
    * Added update status functions for Node and Cluster DB objects
    * Added get node by id function in objects model
    * cluster status update in objects class to DB
    * node status update in objects class to DB
    * Get VM status task unit tests
    * Get RabbitMQ status task unit tests
    * Update cluster status task unit tests
    * Updated existing tasks and create cluster flow tests for DB support
    * Updated existing tests and test fixtures for matched behavior
      with devstack clients and their mocked versions

Change-Id: I7b07e1a179b9b5e64218db9c64417d72be02cac9

Joseph', 'email': 'lyz@princessleia.com', 'username': 'lyz'}, {'_account_id': 8873, 'name': 'Assaf Muller', 'email': 'amuller@redhat.com', 'username': 'amuller'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 17:34:36.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove explicit pylint job for Neutron

Change [1] proposes to fold the pylint check execution into the
gate-neutron-pep8 job. This job has long stopped being about pep8
only long time ago, so adding pylint to the mix does sound like
an acceptable thing to do, especially if this way it is easier to
handle breakages, and save a node per each change being tested.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/159198/
Depends-on: Ida6ae44a837d1761f5ce3e8a92f8850407f5cd16

Change-Id: Ida96a7e8611cb59a002a24eb07f356d6bddd63f5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove explicit pylint job for Neutron

Change [1] proposes to fold the pylint check execution into the
gate-neutron-pep8 job. This job has long stopped being about pep8
only long time ago, so adding pylint to the mix does sound like
an acceptable thing to do, especially if this way it is easier to
handle breakages, and save a node per each change being tested.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/159198/
Depends-on: Ida6ae44a837d1761f5ce3e8a92f8850407f5cd16

Change-Id: Ida96a7e8611cb59a002a24eb07f356d6bddd63f5

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-18 13:53:45.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Change config of keystone_authtoken in lib/ironic

This commit is temporary work-around until Ironic is fixed(bug#1422632)

The reason of creating temporary work-around is following
Ironic re-uses specific values from the keystone_authtoken middleware.
So we should specify admin_user, admin_password and so on instead of username, password.

Change-Id: If8869e16a167eea0af87afda0eabcbb803627db6
Closes-Bug: #1418341 at devstack
'}]
commit_message:
Change config of keystone_authtoken in lib/ironic

This commit is temporary work-around until Ironic is fixed(bug#1422632)

The reason of creating temporary work-around is following
Ironic re-uses specific values from the keystone_authtoken middleware.
So we should specify admin_user, admin_password and so on instead of username, password.

Change-Id: If8869e16a167eea0af87afda0eabcbb803627db6
Closes-Bug: #1418341 at devstack

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-25 06:57:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/hacking/checks.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_hacking.py'], 'message': 'Skip api version hacking check on unrelated files

V2.1 API is implemented under nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3
and the api version hacking check is necessary for files under the

This patch makes the hacking rule skip for unrelated files.

Change-Id: I6fc49ade6bd4602aff5b0552d33abae3e8a5b03b
'}]
commit_message:
Skip api version hacking check on unrelated files

V2.1 API is implemented under nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3
and the api version hacking check is necessary for files under the
directory only.
This patch makes the hacking rule skip for unrelated files.

Change-Id: I6fc49ade6bd4602aff5b0552d33abae3e8a5b03b

commit_message:
add jobboard trash method

This allows you to move a job to the trash so it
will not be re-attempted, but while also leaving
the details behind for diagnostic purposes.

Change-Id: I3126e8d771e4012241a5fba1cd61c752f87c9952
Implements: blueprint jobboard-garbage-bin

subject: Allow users to be domain scoped
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 08:06:24.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/identity/v3/json/token_client.py', 'tempest/auth.py', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Allow users to be domain scoped

Add the user_domain_name and project_domain_name parameters to config. If no
project is specified then having domain_name specified on its own implies
asking for a domain scoped token.

Change-Id: Ie52881a681cc0a65b386dd28bd59ea8a2d55de55
Closes-Bug: #1420605
'}]
commit_message:
Allow users to be domain scoped

Add the user_domain_name and project_domain_name parameters to config. If no
project is specified then having domain_name specified on its own implies
asking for a domain scoped token.

Change-Id: Ie52881a681cc0a65b386dd28bd59ea8a2d55de55
Closes-Bug: #1420605

No more usage of unknown or infinity.

Closes bug: #1421843

commit_message:
Use updated trove mysql image location

Use the updated trove mysql image at:
tarballs.openstack.org/trove/images/ubuntu/mysql.qcow2
instead of the older deprecated image at:
tarballs.openstack.org/trove/images/ubuntu_mysql.qcow2/ubuntu_mysql.qcow2

backport new image location to juno, so we use the cached new image and
not the deprecated one.

Change-Id: If76f25dfe0f975faf1883f0a6d993c21b26e1b29
(cherry picked from commit 3ec8a9032724a5ad86d80b3ac3ef7143c6c68890)

commit_message:
fix 'None type' object error when suspend vm

Pass the context to driver when suspend vm.
Fix the hyperv,libvirt,vmware,xen driver that
implement it.

Change-Id: I9d6ec403787bce26cdcf91a0acf84487e5ddfe8f
Closes-bug: #1413855

commit_message:
Moving base driver code to a new location

Moving base lbaas v2 driver modules to their new location - drivers/
instead of the old one - services/loadbalancer/drivers/

This change set is a preparation for next-coming new lbaas v2 drivers
implementations

commit_message:
Setup LBaaS V2 Agent Scheduler and Driver

Adding the lbaas agent scheduler extension for v2.  Adding in
the migrations needed to store the agent loadbalancer associations.
Also adding the python package/directory structure, and minor code
additions for the dependent reviews.

Partially-implements: blueprint lbaas-refactor-haproxy-namespace-driver-to-new-driver-interface

Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Ifc09e922e9afbdfa31d2edf022c28d56446a9403

subject: Elements for building a heat test image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 22:49:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat-test-image/elements/centos7-rdo/element-deps', 'heat-test-image/elements/heat-config-hook-requires/package-installs.yaml', 'tools/build-heat-test-image.sh', 'heat-test-image/elements/heat-agent-pkg-requires/pkg-map', 'heat-test-image/elements/centos7-rdo/pkg-map', 'heat-test-image/elements/heat-config-hook-requires/element-deps', 'heat-test-image/elements/python-dev/element-deps', 'heat-test-image/elements/python-dev/pkg-map', 'heat-test-image/elements/heat-agent-pkg-requires/README.md', 'heat-test-image/elements/heat-config-hook-requires/README.md', 'heat-test-image/elements/python-dev/README.md', 'heat-test-image/elements/centos7-rdo/README.md', 'heat-test-image/elements/heat-agent-pkg-requires/element-deps', 'heat-test-image/elements/heat-config-hook-requires/pkg-map', 'heat-test-image/elements/python-dev/package-installs.yaml', 'heat-test-image/elements/centos7-rdo/package-installs.yaml', 'heat-test-image/elements/heat-agent-pkg-requires/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': "Elements for building a heat test image

The heat functional test job needs to boot full images containing
the heat agent code (os-collect-config etc) so that it can test the
interaction between heat and the agent.

Images built with the elements in this change contain the necessary
distro packages so that only pip packages need to be installed on
server boot. This is very fast compared to doing a disk-image-create
on every gate run or doing distro package installs during boot.

Initially pip packages would be installed from upstream pypi during
boot, but devstack already has the code required [1] to build pip repos
from local git checkouts so it will be possible to check and gate
on agent code changes, which is not currently possible.

The intent would be for these images to replace the vanilla
Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda which devstack currently uses during
gate jobs. The Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda qcow is cached on the
nodepool images but it might be better for these images to be hosted
on a server like tarballs.o.o and downloaded on every gate run.
Initially I'd like to request that an image be manually built and
uploaded somewhere so we can start using it immediately and drop
Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda.

Building these images does not need to be fully automated and likely
only needs to be triggered when there are dependency changes in the
heat agent tools.

The script tools/build-heat-test-image.sh will trigger a image build
defaulting to fedora. Ubuntu and CentOS7 are also fully supported by
these elements.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/dib#L52

Change-Id: I17fdb70c4b0e3d7d805983e61230b9c7c74dbbdb
"}]
commit_message:
Elements for building a heat test image

The heat functional test job needs to boot full images containing
the heat agent code (os-collect-config etc) so that it can test the
interaction between heat and the agent.

Images built with the elements in this change contain the necessary
distro packages so that only pip packages need to be installed on
server boot. This is very fast compared to doing a disk-image-create
on every gate run or doing distro package installs during boot.

Initially pip packages would be installed from upstream pypi during
boot, but devstack already has the code required [1] to build pip repos
from local git checkouts so it will be possible to check and gate
on agent code changes, which is not currently possible.

The intent would be for these images to replace the vanilla
Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda which devstack currently uses during
gate jobs. The Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda qcow is cached on the
nodepool images but it might be better for these images to be hosted
on a server like tarballs.o.o and downloaded on every gate run.
Initially I'd like to request that an image be manually built and
uploaded somewhere so we can start using it immediately and drop
Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda.

Building these images does not need to be fully automated and likely
only needs to be triggered when there are dependency changes in the
heat agent tools.

The script tools/build-heat-test-image.sh will trigger a image build
defaulting to fedora. Ubuntu and CentOS7 are also fully supported by
these elements.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/dib#L52

revisions:
[{'number': 28, 'created': '2015-02-17 17:43:38.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/isolate-scheduler-db-filters.rst'], 'message': "Isolate Scheduler DB for Instances

Some filters need information about the current instances on a host in
order to make their decisions. Currently they get their filtering
criteria by accessing the nova DB or API directly. This spec proposes
adding the instance information to the current query run when the
HostManager calls 'get_all_host_states()', eliminating the need for the
filters to make additional calls to get that information.

Change-Id: Id90a699ab8d456e7a8a66637b738aa373e12e736
"}]
commit_message:
Isolate Scheduler DB for Instances

Some filters need information about the current instances on a host in
order to make their decisions. Currently they get their filtering
criteria by accessing the nova DB or API directly. This spec proposes
adding the instance information to the current query run when the
HostManager calls 'get_all_host_states()', eliminating the need for the
filters to make additional calls to get that information.

Change-Id: Id90a699ab8d456e7a8a66637b738aa373e12e736

subject: Adjust Oslo maintained library caps
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 01:13:41.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Adjust Oslo maintained library caps

For non-openstack maintained projects we are concerned about leaving
room for any future library versions, as we aren't sure they won't break
things.  But for oslo maintained projects this isn't an issue. The
OpenStack community is maintaining them and can make sure the releases
allowed here won't break things.

This is done as a follow up patch to pin everything, because tweaking
library versions is somewhat risky and we should land the pin everything
patch as soon as possible, and it is currently working.

Change-Id: Ic1b9733f0602228bf79620411d495fad9473203f
"}]
commit_message:
Adjust Oslo maintained library caps

For non-openstack maintained projects we are concerned about leaving
room for any future library versions, as we aren't sure they won't break
things.  But for oslo maintained projects this isn't an issue. The
OpenStack community is maintaining them and can make sure the releases
allowed here won't break things.

This is done as a follow up patch to pin everything, because tweaking
library versions is somewhat risky and we should land the pin everything
patch as soon as possible, and it is currently working.

Change-Id: Ic1b9733f0602228bf79620411d495fad9473203f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-26 01:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['.pylintrc', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Move pylint checks to pep8 testenv

This change proposes to move pylint violation checks to the pep8
testenv. This changes make pylint gating within Neutron as it would
participate in the vote.  Having pylint executed on a separate job makes
it difficult to handle potential unexpected breakages, because we need
to get infra involved. When we need to renable the job, it is equally
painful.

Furthermore, it also causes us to spin an extra node, when the checks
can easily be handled by the node for the pep8 job.

Finally, having pylint running with tox -epep8 "helps" developers
become aware of pylint violations sooner rather than later, if they
"forget" to run the pylint testenv too before submitting the change.

In order to make this patch succeed, a couple of pylint violation
checks were skipped, as they slipped in, whilst the job was non-voting.

We'll tackle them in due course.

Change-Id: Ida6ae44a837d1761f5ce3e8a92f8850407f5cd16
'}]
commit_message:
Move pylint checks to pep8 testenv

This change proposes to move pylint violation checks to the pep8
testenv. This changes make pylint gating within Neutron as it would
participate in the vote.  Having pylint executed on a separate job makes
it difficult to handle potential unexpected breakages, because we need
to get infra involved. When we need to renable the job, it is equally
painful.

Furthermore, it also causes us to spin an extra node, when the checks
can easily be handled by the node for the pep8 job.

Finally, having pylint running with tox -epep8 "helps" developers
become aware of pylint violations sooner rather than later, if they
"forget" to run the pylint testenv too before submitting the change.

In order to make this patch succeed, a couple of pylint violation
checks were skipped, as they slipped in, whilst the job was non-voting.

We'll tackle them in due course.

Change-Id: Ida6ae44a837d1761f5ce3e8a92f8850407f5cd16

Since midonet has become open source, we can build it from

plugin approach:

    disable_service n-net
    enable_service q-svc
    enable_service q-dhcp
    enable_service q-meta
    enable_plugin networking-midonet \
        http://github.com/stackforge/networking-midonet

'}]
commit_message:
Improve MidoNet integration

Since midonet has become open source, we can build it from
external plugin scripts. The way to enable it is using the devstack
plugin approach:

    disable_service n-net
    enable_service q-svc
    enable_service q-dhcp
    enable_service q-meta
    enable_plugin networking-midonet \
        http://github.com/stackforge/networking-midonet
    Q_PLUGIN=midonet

and should download and build the last master branch of midonet.

Change-Id: I795f92f9d3c97b2c35bac712c6edfc032eff345a

subject: Add route table when failing to find host IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-06 20:50:52.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': "Add route table when failing to find host IP

The host IP doesn't get set sometimes, even though there is a robust
algorithm for determining the default. This will add the output of 'ip
route' to any errors, which should aid debugging failures.

Change-Id: I2105f60d5bedf728a461ff6d56c7b328129aed54
"}]
commit_message:
Add route table when failing to find host IP

The host IP doesn't get set sometimes, even though there is a robust
algorithm for determining the default. This will add the output of 'ip
route' to any errors, which should aid debugging failures.

Change-Id: I2105f60d5bedf728a461ff6d56c7b328129aed54

subject: Make sure all rsyslog written logs are rotated
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-13 02:22:13.000000000', 'files': ['elements/os-svc-install/logrotate.d/rsyslog', 'elements/os-svc-install/install.d/04-os-svc-install'], 'message': 'Make sure all rsyslog written logs are rotated

Currently we write to /var/log/$programname.log for all rsyslog managed
logs. We need to make sure those get rotated.

The dpkg logrotate configuration causes a duplicate log file error and
thus must be removed. It is possible other elements will install their
own logrotate configurations which also cause issues, but those are
nearly impossible to detect reliably until runtime.

Change-Id: Ibe1397951fe28034a78b1c6f7e94d7a6f31fac18
Closes-Bug: #1409991
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure all rsyslog written logs are rotated

Currently we write to /var/log/$programname.log for all rsyslog managed
logs. We need to make sure those get rotated.

The dpkg logrotate configuration causes a duplicate log file error and
thus must be removed. It is possible other elements will install their
own logrotate configurations which also cause issues, but those are
nearly impossible to detect reliably until runtime.

Change-Id: Ibe1397951fe28034a78b1c6f7e94d7a6f31fac18
Closes-Bug: #1409991

The "ephemeral" disk is (ab)used as a permanent store, but sometimes the
disk that Ironic sets up as the ephemeral disk is not setup the way we
want for this particular image. Also there is another scenario which is
that Ironic may be blissfully unaware of whatever device we want to use,
and will not have given Nova a chance to mkfs on it yet.

The interface defined here simply allows image builders to create a

commit_message:
Provide interface to pre-config "ephemeral" disk

The "ephemeral" disk is (ab)used as a permanent store, but sometimes the
disk that Ironic sets up as the ephemeral disk is not setup the way we
want for this particular image. Also there is another scenario which is
that Ironic may be blissfully unaware of whatever device we want to use,
and will not have given Nova a chance to mkfs on it yet.

The interface defined here simply allows image builders to create a
script which will prepare the ephemeral disk, or replace it with some
other more suitable device.

Change-Id: I46c8abb1d07fabffceda7cb6c411e685b59d9f35

commit_message:
Install openstackclient after other services

Let's see whether openstackclient will trigger unneeded version bump for
clients if its installation is put below all other services that are
expected to intall client libraries on proper versions on their own.

Conflicts:
	stack.sh

Change-Id: Ifa774219b7057112fc794a5e3d93bc963c55ba90
(cherry picked from commit 1ffa33210def38e488b8887c69b70faad5965a00)

subject: Do not default pecan_debug to CONF.debug
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-26 20:26:40.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/app.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/test_app.py'], 'message': "Do not default pecan_debug to CONF.debug

Pecan's debug mode can be terribly insecure; 500 errors return a
Python traceback, the full list of environment variables, and a
button to replay the request with a breakpoint.

Deployers often run OpenStack services in debug mode; doing so should
not open the service up to these flaws. Defaulting pecan_debug to
CONF.debug makes this easy to accidentally do. So, default it to False
rather than riding on top of CONF.debug.

Change-Id: I70f9c9807d16aa50df4d5e16ba2a29575f8b165e
Closes-Bug: #1425206
DocImpact
"}]
commit_message:
Do not default pecan_debug to CONF.debug

Pecan's debug mode can be terribly insecure; 500 errors return a
Python traceback, the full list of environment variables, and a
button to replay the request with a breakpoint.

Deployers often run OpenStack services in debug mode; doing so should
not open the service up to these flaws. Defaulting pecan_debug to
CONF.debug makes this easy to accidentally do. So, default it to False
rather than riding on top of CONF.debug.

Change-Id: I70f9c9807d16aa50df4d5e16ba2a29575f8b165e
Closes-Bug: #1425206
DocImpact

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-25 03:24:26.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/pkg.py'], 'message': 'Fixes package configuration method in pkg.py

Reasons:
- Package configuration method _fix_package_selections is failing.
- Because of pkg._fix_package_selections failing, the code fails to configure
  the mysql guest in case it does not have the package installed,
  which in-turn causes guest to fail.

Changes:
- Divided the command into two separate executions
  in pkg._fix_package_selections
- Also added the exception handling block around utils.execute in
  pkg._fix_package_selections so that correct exception could be visible.

Change-Id: I8f7bff9dccb7521189bd0eb08bb4b9e67d514ff8
Closes-Bug: #1392870
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes package configuration method in pkg.py

Reasons:
- Package configuration method _fix_package_selections is failing.
- Because of pkg._fix_package_selections failing, the code fails to configure
  the mysql guest in case it does not have the package installed,
  which in-turn causes guest to fail.

Changes:
- Divided the command into two separate executions
  in pkg._fix_package_selections
- Also added the exception handling block around utils.execute in
  pkg._fix_package_selections so that correct exception could be visible.

Change-Id: I8f7bff9dccb7521189bd0eb08bb4b9e67d514ff8
Closes-Bug: #1392870

commit_message:
Test StructuredConfig validate more completely

We need to test that validate() works on StructuredConfig with
get_input. This adds a test that just makes sure the built resource
validates.

We will build on top of this in a later patch to ensure that get_input
can be used as an argument for intrinsic functions.

Change-Id: I166742ef6cb67db1ccce3f3cc06f218d3286760c
Related-Bug: #1344284

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint Implement a container set for database control

Previously, the database container was configured for use with
Kubernetes. This patch removed any k8s dependencies, adds a script
to manage mysql server.cnf settings and splits data and app
containers. Splitting the containers provides additional
portability and operational efficiencies compared to host mounts.

Change-Id: Ie5487e095d91e603a368e8324ba788b26fa28478
