commit_message:
Add methods to store and check access to Metadata

We have the ability to register an access handler currently, but this
makes it so that the entire stack must be parsed just to read Metadata.

We are going to deprecate the arbitrary handler ability once we have
the ability to register specific keys that are granted access. Then we
won't need to parse the entire stack just to display metadata.

Change-Id: I886ef2d4f2c228d5b286927fb843915961ef1e17
Related-Bug: #1306743

Configure auth_token middleware for Ironic

so currently fails when using this values. This fixes it.

commit_message:
Fail when no tests are run

Currently when testr fails to list any tests, no tests are run, so none
fail so the tempest script exits with success.

This patch adds some error handling around testr list-tests so that
errors are output to the console and the script halts on error.

There are also two tests added to check that full_test_list and
test_list are not empty.

Change-Id: I5055759a7d63d1f3a52cc60c6f29e541871ce238
Closes-Bug: #1425318
(cherry picked from commit d118d94abc90b9c947923522841794c2a48ff3e1)

commit_message:
Copy image from source host when ImageNotFound

This patch builds on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/90321/ to
handle the case of offline migration (the aforementioned patch
handles only live migration). When images are not found in
glance, copy the missing images from the source host so migration
may proceed.

Closes-Bug: #1329313

Change-Id: I2c9fd63d0950fa9f3854c1c20cb7722d1c97b127

commit_message:
Simplify usage of ec2utils.get_db_item

At the moment we cann't completely get rid of validation of a kind of
an object ID, because common parameter validator doesn't validate
complex parameters. So this validation is still used in several cases.

Change-Id: Ibbe73a74306f2359f6554fcc8ef7bc31d356c167

commit_message:
Allow handling multiple service_types

If the same service_type was mentioned in the catalog more than once
then only the last entry would be parsed and any possible other matches
would be lost.

This was something that novaclient used to do, and as we are pushing
sessions as the way that clients should all work we need to maintain
that compatibility.

Change-Id: I6964515ed1975bce1998897abfc02a1ec36e2584
Closes-Bug: #1425766

It seems we have the options to start and enable nova floating ips
but we don't have any attributes to override to use them if wanted.

if you want to.

Change-Id: I0998fe1b704460240171c4dd2dd7cc00b5fc0390
"}]
commit_message:
Fix to enable floating ips with nova

It seems we have the options to start and enable nova floating ips
but we don't have any attributes to override to use them if wanted.
This patch defaults off with floating ips, but explains how to start it
if you want to.

Change-Id: I0998fe1b704460240171c4dd2dd7cc00b5fc0390

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-10-16 16:38:07.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_storage_policy.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': "Allow Diskfile to choose whether to cleanup old files per policy

The EC design spec explains how, in order to protect from partial
PUT failures where less than a quorum was committed, the last
durable set of object fragments needs to be maintained until
the next set is confirmed to be present.

This is in cooperation with the reconstructor, this patch simply
adds the check in Diskfile to delete or not based on policy. Note
that this option doesn't apply to .ts files which will be cleaned

commit_message:
Allow Diskfile to choose whether to cleanup old files per policy

The EC design spec explains how, in order to protect from partial
PUT failures where less than a quorum was committed, the last
durable set of object fragments needs to be maintained until
the next set is confirmed to be present.

This is in cooperation with the reconstructor, this patch simply
adds the check in Diskfile to delete or not based on policy. Note
that this option doesn't apply to .ts files which will be cleaned
up as before regardless of policy.

Change-Id: I3befce8e823c16a8536729acdadcc32eef9b23e1
Implements: blueprint swift-ec

subject: EC: HTTP PUT/HEAD changes for object size/etag reporting
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5189, 'name': 'Yuan Zhou', 'email': 'dunk007@gmail.com', 'username': 'yuan-zhou'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7485, 'name': 'Tushar Gohad', 'email': 'tushar.gohad@intel.com', 'username': 'tsg'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-23 02:05:06.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py'], 'message': "EC: HTTP PUT/HEAD changes for object size/etag reporting

Non-replication storage policies, such as 'erasure_coding' do not
store original object size and md5 hash in the Content-Length and
Etag metadata attributes that are typically stored with an object.
These policies use custom sysmeta attributes to store the size/md5
of the original object data.  For example, the 'erasure_coding'
policies use 'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Content-Length' and
'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Etag' metadata elements.

This patch also updates the tail of the PUT path to make sure we
update the container metadata with original object metadata
(Etag, Content-Length) and not the metadata for the on-disk
representation of the object

Changes -

 - Add support for mapping custom policy metadata fields to 'Etag'
   and 'Content-Length'
 - Add a response_metadata_items() method per policy to get the
   Etag/Content-Length mappings and also to get any custom metadata
   attributes object server wants to send back in a HEAD response
 - PUT changes to write correct object Etag/Content-Length values
   for original object data during container update
 - HEAD changes to make use of respose_metadata_items() to report
   original object attributes/customer metadata items in HEAD
   response

Change-Id: I769b263c675b71e4439ee87dda05d36ca900573a
Implements: blueprint ec-proxy-work
"}]
commit_message:
EC: HTTP PUT/HEAD changes for object size/etag reporting

Non-replication storage policies, such as 'erasure_coding' do not
store original object size and md5 hash in the Content-Length and
Etag metadata attributes that are typically stored with an object.
These policies use custom sysmeta attributes to store the size/md5
of the original object data.  For example, the 'erasure_coding'
policies use 'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Content-Length' and
'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Etag' metadata elements.

This patch also updates the tail of the PUT path to make sure we
update the container metadata with original object metadata
(Etag, Content-Length) and not the metadata for the on-disk
representation of the object

Changes -

 - Add support for mapping custom policy metadata fields to 'Etag'
   and 'Content-Length'
 - Add a response_metadata_items() method per policy to get the
   Etag/Content-Length mappings and also to get any custom metadata
   attributes object server wants to send back in a HEAD response
 - PUT changes to write correct object Etag/Content-Length values
   for original object data during container update
 - HEAD changes to make use of respose_metadata_items() to report
   original object attributes/customer metadata items in HEAD
   response

Change-Id: I769b263c675b71e4439ee87dda05d36ca900573a
Implements: blueprint ec-proxy-work

subject: Create new config for pecan debug mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 19:45:28.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/config.py', 'ironic/api/app.py'], 'message': "Create new config for pecan debug mode

Pecan's debug mode can be terribly insecure; 500 errors return a
Python traceback, the full list of environment variables, and a
button to replay the request with a breakpoint.

Deployers often run OpenStack services in debug mode; doing so should
not open the service up to these flaws. However, it may be useful
to use Pecan's debug mode in development, so create a config option
to enable it, rather than disable it altogether.

Change-Id: I5bc76b4101c563cdc168d2e55db060c1bdd0b5fe
Closes-Bug: #1425206
"}]
commit_message:
Create new config for pecan debug mode

Pecan's debug mode can be terribly insecure; 500 errors return a
Python traceback, the full list of environment variables, and a
button to replay the request with a breakpoint.

Deployers often run OpenStack services in debug mode; doing so should
not open the service up to these flaws. However, it may be useful
to use Pecan's debug mode in development, so create a config option
to enable it, rather than disable it altogether.

Change-Id: I5bc76b4101c563cdc168d2e55db060c1bdd0b5fe
Closes-Bug: #1425206

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 15:23:56.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/targets/scst.py'], 'message': 'Use Unique SCST Group names in SCST cinder helper driver.

Currently, while setting up GROUPS under targets in scst.conf,
we are using the Initiator IQN as the group name. When we have
multiple targets and we want to connect LUN's from these multiple
targets to the same initiator, we are using the same GROUP name in
all the Target sections.

It would be good to provide a unique group name by prepending the
GROUP name with the target name. So the GROUP name will be
"Target name+Initiator IQN".

Change-Id: Ia0fbab18f792e602e1f4dae6f9ca0e607d0cfde3
Closes-Bug: #1424973
'}]
commit_message:
Use Unique SCST Group names in SCST cinder helper driver.

Currently, while setting up GROUPS under targets in scst.conf,
we are using the Initiator IQN as the group name. When we have
multiple targets and we want to connect LUN's from these multiple
targets to the same initiator, we are using the same GROUP name in
all the Target sections.

It would be good to provide a unique group name by prepending the
GROUP name with the target name. So the GROUP name will be
"Target name+Initiator IQN".

Change-Id: Ia0fbab18f792e602e1f4dae6f9ca0e607d0cfde3
Closes-Bug: #1424973

subject: Cinder Pagination Sorting Enhancements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-04 21:59:46.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/volume-sorting.rst'], 'message': "Cinder Pagination Sorting Enhancements

Commit Ia8781ed2d37fa2a0cb711a7f98d06919fc8a79d0 approved supporting multiple
sort keys and directions in the GET volumes REST APIs by using repeated
'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' query string parameters. This patch set updates the
existing spec to align with the API working group sorting guidelines by using
a single 'sort' query string parameter.

bp cinder-pagination
APIImpact

Change-Id: I95f7123d48ba4d9526617aba9ca60a9951d25faf
"}]
commit_message:
Cinder Pagination Sorting Enhancements

Commit Ia8781ed2d37fa2a0cb711a7f98d06919fc8a79d0 approved supporting multiple
sort keys and directions in the GET volumes REST APIs by using repeated
'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' query string parameters. This patch set updates the
existing spec to align with the API working group sorting guidelines by using
a single 'sort' query string parameter.

bp cinder-pagination
APIImpact

Change-Id: I95f7123d48ba4d9526617aba9ca60a9951d25faf

subject: Add snapshot gigabytes quota
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-26 07:42:28.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/test_quotas.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/services/share/json/shares_client.py', 'manila/tests/test_quota.py', 'manila/api/contrib/used_limits.py', 'manila/common/config.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_api.py', 'manila/share/api.py', 'manila/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/admin/test_quotas.py', 'manila/share/manager.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/admin/test_quotas_negative.py', 'manila/api/views/limits.py', 'manila/quota.py', 'manila/exception.py'], 'message': "Add snapshot gigabytes quota

Manila has used single gigabytes quota for shares and snapshots.
Config opt 'no_snapshot_gb_quota' is set to False by default, that has been
used for enabling/disabling of snapshot gigabytes quota considerations.

Add separate snapshot gigabyte quota and remove opt 'no_snapshot_gb_quota' that
is not needed anymore. To be able to set infinite quota for snapshot gigabytes,
just set value for new config option 'quota_snapshot_gigabytes' to '-1'.

Change-Id: I43cb95ff3d0d3e6191f520b52edb67a0a44e9c2c
Implements BP add-snapshot-gb-quota
"}]
commit_message:
Add snapshot gigabytes quota

Manila has used single gigabytes quota for shares and snapshots.
Config opt 'no_snapshot_gb_quota' is set to False by default, that has been
used for enabling/disabling of snapshot gigabytes quota considerations.

Add separate snapshot gigabyte quota and remove opt 'no_snapshot_gb_quota' that
is not needed anymore. To be able to set infinite quota for snapshot gigabytes,
just set value for new config option 'quota_snapshot_gigabytes' to '-1'.

Change-Id: I43cb95ff3d0d3e6191f520b52edb67a0a44e9c2c
Implements BP add-snapshot-gb-quota

commit_message:
Update repo with new testing suite

The new testing suite is based upon Chef 12, Chef DK and
Chef Provisioning.  It supports all in one and multi node
environments.  It will be used as the base for future gate
integration testing.  There's is more work to as noted in
the TODO list at the botton of the readme.

Note: to get this thru the existing gate, had to keep the existing
Gemfile.  Added a Gemfile-Provisioning for new stuff and updated
readme with some notes on that.  When we make the switch to kilo
rake gates, we can decide what type of gates the repo needs. I think
it's ready for rubocop at least and maybe continue with something
like spiecweasel to look at the role and environment syntax.

Added draft bootstrap and test default to rubocop to rakefile to
allow for easy integration with new gate rake jobs.

Change-Id: I187df8b78c4cecfb783ab26a6b66b8e8dd6745bd

Add driver method to implement the unrescue operation.

can disconnect any disk mapping.

subject: Change test order to avoid incompatibliity
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-28 14:39:25.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Change test order to avoid incompatibliity

If py26 or py27 tests are run first, there is a incompatibility in
the .testrepository that breaks several tests.  To get around this,
you need to run the py33 tests first.  This change was made over in
the cliff project.

Before:
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ rm -rf .testrepository/
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ tox
      ...
      py26: commands succeeded
      py27: commands succeeded
    ERROR:   py33: commands failed
    ERROR:   py34: commands failed
    ERROR:   pypy: commands failed
      pep8: commands succeeded
After:
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ rm -rf .testrepository/
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ tox
      ...
      py33: commands succeeded
      py34: commands succeeded
      py26: commands succeeded
      py27: commands succeeded
      pypy: commands succeeded
      pep8: commands succeeded
      congratulations :)
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$

Change-Id: I837eecd55e51c3ff10f8e9429f5eca94a2e58b38
'}]
commit_message:
Change test order to avoid incompatibliity

If py26 or py27 tests are run first, there is a incompatibility in
the .testrepository that breaks several tests.  To get around this,
you need to run the py33 tests first.  This change was made over in
the cliff project.

Before:
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ rm -rf .testrepository/
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ tox
      ...
      py26: commands succeeded
      py27: commands succeeded
    ERROR:   py33: commands failed
    ERROR:   py34: commands failed
    ERROR:   pypy: commands failed
      pep8: commands succeeded
After:
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ rm -rf .testrepository/
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ tox
      ...
      py33: commands succeeded
      py34: commands succeeded
      py26: commands succeeded
      py27: commands succeeded
      pypy: commands succeeded
      pep8: commands succeeded
      congratulations :)
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$

Change-Id: I837eecd55e51c3ff10f8e9429f5eca94a2e58b38

subject: Add Nova-network support to service_instance module
revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-02-25 12:10:15.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/service_instance.py', 'manila/tests/network/neutron/test_neutron_api.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/test_service_instance.py', 'manila/tests/fake_network.py', 'manila/network/neutron/api.py', 'manila/share/manager.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/test_generic.py', 'manila/compute/nova.py', 'manila/tests/compute/test_nova.py', 'manila/share/drivers/generic.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Add Nova-network support to service_instance module

Till that moment it was possible to use Generic driver only with Neutron.
Nova network still is used in various deployments, so add support for it.

List of changes:
- Split service_instance to two parts - compute and networking.
- Implement networking part as 'network helpers'.
- Add new config option 'service_instance_network_helper_type' that supports
only two values - 'nova' and 'neutron' respectively.
It is required option. Default value is 'neutron'.

Details on Nova-network approach:
- Due to resctrictions of Nova network, where security group rules are applied
to all VM network interfaces, no need to create service network, because it
will be just duplication. Service instance will use only one network that is
provided within share-network entity.
- Host of manila-share service should have network connectivity for all
networks, that are going to be used for share creations.
- Nova network helper does not create resources, so, network is not configured
by Manila in that case. So, network infrastructure can be either flat or using
VLAN segmentation as well.

Implements BP nova-network-support-in-generic-driver
Implements BP split-service-instance
Change-Id: I7462fe3d6fa944d391628b8e2b374cf5593924ea
"}]
commit_message:
Add Nova-network support to service_instance module

Till that moment it was possible to use Generic driver only with Neutron.
Nova network still is used in various deployments, so add support for it.

List of changes:
- Split service_instance to two parts - compute and networking.
- Implement networking part as 'network helpers'.
- Add new config option 'service_instance_network_helper_type' that supports
only two values - 'nova' and 'neutron' respectively.
It is required option. Default value is 'neutron'.

Details on Nova-network approach:
- Due to resctrictions of Nova network, where security group rules are applied
to all VM network interfaces, no need to create service network, because it
will be just duplication. Service instance will use only one network that is
provided within share-network entity.
- Host of manila-share service should have network connectivity for all
networks, that are going to be used for share creations.
- Nova network helper does not create resources, so, network is not configured
by Manila in that case. So, network infrastructure can be either flat or using
VLAN segmentation as well.

Implements BP nova-network-support-in-generic-driver
Implements BP split-service-instance
Change-Id: I7462fe3d6fa944d391628b8e2b374cf5593924ea

commit_message:
Use HTTP BASIC AUTH exclusively (no longer use JSESSIONID)

It also fixes an issue about the former auth implementation when ODL
restarts. It implies the use of OpenDaylight Helium SR2.

Closes-Bug: 1376169
Closes-Bug: 1419499

Conflicts:
	networking_odl/common/client.py

Change-Id: I97c610578fe489b25697394fa33f5410f0bfbe1b
Signed-off-by: Ed Warnicke <eaw@cisco.com>
(cherry picked from commit f25f85eaeca1deeada6c7fd70abf83b31046c89e)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-06-10 00:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/045_shrink_tenant_id.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Reduce length of tenant ID

Keystone only stores tenant as ia 64-character strings, so there is no
reason for Heat to store it as a 256 character string. Also 256
character UTF-8 strings cannot be indexed by MySQL, and will also be
stored as a TINYTEXT column, resulting in slower performance.

Note that we do not need to alter the software_deployment and
software_config back to 256, because they have been reduced to that
length by I27b9c61828301ba8c392b3d316f656641af753bc.

Change-Id: Ib4a99a0e84c7bd17fdaf4874e1b36d75f14c4c6a
Related-Bug: #1316646
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce length of tenant ID

Keystone only stores tenant as ia 64-character strings, so there is no
reason for Heat to store it as a 256 character string. Also 256
character UTF-8 strings cannot be indexed by MySQL, and will also be
stored as a TINYTEXT column, resulting in slower performance.

Note that we do not need to alter the software_deployment and
software_config back to 256, because they have been reduced to that
length by I27b9c61828301ba8c392b3d316f656641af753bc.

Change-Id: Ib4a99a0e84c7bd17fdaf4874e1b36d75f14c4c6a
Related-Bug: #1316646

commit_message:
Fix co-dependent tempest issues

We noticed at the gate for icehouse alone that tempest tests were not
being collected or run. This was due to the fact that the version of
tempest we checkout has vendorized oslo.log code from oslo-incubator
which has a dependency on oslo.serialization.

We don't deploy swift in icehouse so tempest tests are not going to
work.

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders<hugh@wherenow.org>

Change-Id: I416c4db4c6689cdcd701747e5cb1d566eae72140
Closes-bug: 1425767

subject: Register our own ConnectionPool without globals

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-06 19:49:32.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/common/https.py', 'tests/test_ssl.py'], 'message': 'Register our own ConnectionPool without globals

Currently, on systems like Fedora and Debian, it is possible to import
urllib3 as well as requests.packages.urllib3. They functionally point to
the same code but sys.modules considers them to be separate items. When
downstream packagers unvendor urllib3 from requests, they also change
all the imports inside of the package. So if the code imports urllib3
from requests.packages.urllib3 and modifies globals in a submodule, that
will not be visible to requests since it has been rewritten to use
urllib3 (not requests.packages.urllib3). By handling this logic
ourselves, we can issue a release until upstream packages and requests
can fix this and cut a new release.

Change-Id: Ic77ce8a06d9d148a899b4b8695990fca8fdaefc5
Closes-bug: 1396550
'}]
commit_message:
Register our own ConnectionPool without globals

Currently, on systems like Fedora and Debian, it is possible to import
urllib3 as well as requests.packages.urllib3. They functionally point to
the same code but sys.modules considers them to be separate items. When
downstream packagers unvendor urllib3 from requests, they also change
all the imports inside of the package. So if the code imports urllib3
from requests.packages.urllib3 and modifies globals in a submodule, that
will not be visible to requests since it has been rewritten to use
urllib3 (not requests.packages.urllib3). By handling this logic
ourselves, we can issue a release until upstream packages and requests
can fix this and cut a new release.

Change-Id: Ic77ce8a06d9d148a899b4b8695990fca8fdaefc5
Closes-bug: 1396550

commit_message:

On Rackspace there is an automatic IP. The code before inappropriately
attempted to add a floating IP anyway.

There are many use cases where a base image can be customized further.
The element here copies the contents of one image into the new image.

commit_message:
Move install type support to source-repositories

This functionality is documented in source-repositories, not base. So a
user building an image without source-repositories would not expect this
behavior, and also a user building without base, but with
source-repositories, will expect it but not get it.

Change-Id: If9e6eac751c2fdb2bd203eb5d4e25d303f767c10

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-12 09:31:34.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/client.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/tenants.py', 'novaclient/client.py'], 'message': 'nova flavor-access-add does not validate tenantid

nova flavor-access-add command does not validates
if the tenant-id provided by the user is a valid id
or not. It accepts any random string.

After, the changes nova flavor-access-add throws
a command error stating that the tenant does not
exist and you need to provide a vaild tenant-id.
Closes-Bug: #1391737

Change-Id: I0229f818f8043d2242b5158c187dee428e63bc8b
'}]
commit_message:
nova flavor-access-add does not validate tenantid

nova flavor-access-add command does not validates
if the tenant-id provided by the user is a valid id
or not. It accepts any random string.

After, the changes nova flavor-access-add throws
a command error stating that the tenant does not
exist and you need to provide a vaild tenant-id.
Closes-Bug: #1391737

Change-Id: I0229f818f8043d2242b5158c187dee428e63bc8b

It is possible for the arping process to hang if the interface is
removed while it is running. This patch adds a timeout to ensure
that the process eventually exits no matter what.

Change-Id: I60458b91e88b3fbd9fbc19c004e47a005b0ed408
Closes-Bug: #1425173
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure arping always exits

It is possible for the arping process to hang if the interface is
removed while it is running. This patch adds a timeout to ensure
that the process eventually exits no matter what.

Change-Id: I60458b91e88b3fbd9fbc19c004e47a005b0ed408
Closes-Bug: #1425173

subject: Return Error when resize failed
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-15 08:21:04.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/v3/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v3/shell.py'], 'message': "Return Error when resize failed

novaclient can have following output
nova resize --poll t9 12
Server resizing... 100% complete
Finished

but in compute layer it's
ResizeError: Resize error: Unable to resize disk down.

At nova side, it will change the state from ACTIVE to VERFIY_RESIZE
if the resize operation success, if anything fails during the
resize operation, the vm state will be set back to ACTIVE which means
the resize operations failed. And the VERFIY_RESIZE is the only
state that indicates the resize operation success.

It's not easy to fix in nova side because nova API layer will
cast message to compute layer and API layer can't know whether the
instance is successfully resized. This patch follows the existing
nova client mechanism, moves the ACTIVE state out of successful
list because actually it means resize failed.

Change-Id: Ife26f6af144b8c1e42769f76e1d0d850eb54efa2
Closes-Bug: #1323996
"}]
commit_message:
Return Error when resize failed

novaclient can have following output
nova resize --poll t9 12
Server resizing... 100% complete
Finished

but in compute layer it's
ResizeError: Resize error: Unable to resize disk down.

At nova side, it will change the state from ACTIVE to VERFIY_RESIZE
if the resize operation success, if anything fails during the
resize operation, the vm state will be set back to ACTIVE which means
the resize operations failed. And the VERFIY_RESIZE is the only
state that indicates the resize operation success.

It's not easy to fix in nova side because nova API layer will
cast message to compute layer and API layer can't know whether the
instance is successfully resized. This patch follows the existing
nova client mechanism, moves the ACTIVE state out of successful
list because actually it means resize failed.

Change-Id: Ife26f6af144b8c1e42769f76e1d0d850eb54efa2
Closes-Bug: #1323996

commit_message:
Fix KeyErrors from incorrectly formatted NovaExceptions in unit tests

When testr runs it dumps out stacktraces for KeyError when formatting
NovaException messages with missing kwargs. This fixes the incorrect
testing exceptions.

To verify the changes, set fatal_exception_format_errors=True.

Closes-Bug: #1425343

Change-Id: I31de1f98e842cf9cad3a6b93313eb43b658b23d5

subject: Adding user parameter to keypair-list
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-11-26 14:53:50.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/keypairs.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_keypairs.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v3/shell.py'], 'message': 'Adding user parameter to keypair-list

Closes-Bug: #1182965

Administering an openstack cluster I found the need to see what
keypairs a user had. I found this bug that was requesting the
same thing. This is the update to the novaclient to collect the
value and fold it into the api call. Only a user with admin
privilages is allowed to make this call.

Change-Id: I54b4f31b4a74843b340e956d15ffaeb640cedc02
'}]
commit_message:
Adding user parameter to keypair-list

Closes-Bug: #1182965

Administering an openstack cluster I found the need to see what
keypairs a user had. I found this bug that was requesting the
same thing. This is the update to the novaclient to collect the
value and fold it into the api call. Only a user with admin
privilages is allowed to make this call.

Change-Id: I54b4f31b4a74843b340e956d15ffaeb640cedc02

commit_message:
Add CHAP persistence to SCST target helper

The SCST target helper currently does not have a mechanism to
persist CHAP records. Added this support so that LUNs will
get re-exported if Cinder service restarts.

Change-Id: I3daa48e7f460feef9764b79b47d7be308579fe40
Closes-Bug: #1421570

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-02-25 12:14:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/driver_api.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_extension_driver_api.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Passes the plugin context variable in the ML2 Extension Driver API

Many neutron extensions(like portsecurity) use the plugin_context
variable instead of just the database session. This change
modifies the extension driver api to pass the plugin_context

Change request also modifies the extend_XXX resource api to use the
respective data model(network/subnet/port) passed to it.

Implements: blueprint extensions-in-ml2
Partially Implements: blueprint ml2-ovs-portsecurity
Closes-Bug: 1382448
Change-Id: Icf84615e5fee8b59cbc95ab9b634f1a49f4b56a3
'}]
commit_message:
Passes the plugin context variable in the ML2 Extension Driver API

Many neutron extensions(like portsecurity) use the plugin_context
variable instead of just the database session. This change
modifies the extension driver api to pass the plugin_context

Change request also modifies the extend_XXX resource api to use the
respective data model(network/subnet/port) passed to it.

Implements: blueprint extensions-in-ml2
Partially Implements: blueprint ml2-ovs-portsecurity
Closes-Bug: 1382448
Change-Id: Icf84615e5fee8b59cbc95ab9b634f1a49f4b56a3

subject: Add oslo.serialization to the dependencies for tempest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 01:02:26.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_tempest/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add oslo.serialization to the dependencies for tempest

We noticed at the gate for icehouse alone that tempest tests were not
being collected or run. This was due to the fact that the version of
tempest we checkout has vendorized oslo.log code from oslo-incubator
which has a dependency on oslo.serialization.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/os_neutron/tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I416c4db4c6689cdcd701747e5cb1d566eae72140
Closes-bug: 1425767
(cherry picked from commit 4f0f124aef0a05a1e83366c25f3bb79a81f430cd)
'}]
commit_message:
Add oslo.serialization to the dependencies for tempest

We noticed at the gate for icehouse alone that tempest tests were not
being collected or run. This was due to the fact that the version of
tempest we checkout has vendorized oslo.log code from oslo-incubator
which has a dependency on oslo.serialization.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/os_neutron/tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I416c4db4c6689cdcd701747e5cb1d566eae72140
Closes-bug: 1425767
(cherry picked from commit 4f0f124aef0a05a1e83366c25f3bb79a81f430cd)

commit_message:
Create/Delete FIP Agent gateway port only if DVR Routers

A recent patch for creating FloatingIP Agent gateway
port without RPC dependency was trying to create
FloatingIP Agent Gateway port for both Legacy and
DVR routers.
"Change-id: Ieaa79c8bf2b1e03bc352f9252ce22286703e3715"

This patch fixes the problem by checking for the router,
before it tries to create or delete a FloatingIP Agent
Gateway Port.

Change-Id: I588b518d2fffd3943abe6d70fb0308adbe46e974
Closes-Bug: #1423422

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-12 16:45:37.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_thirdparty/README.md', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/ryu', 'lib/neutron', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/bigswitch_floodlight', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/vmware_nsx', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/midonet', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/trema', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "Create validate step for Neutron third-party programs

Add a new function to lib/neutron that can be implemented by scripts under
lib/neutron_thirdparty to validate that the current configuration
is compatible with the third-party program. This can be used, for example, to
ensure that enabled services do not conflict with the third-party program
and that pre-requisite services are enabled. Adding a validate step
relatively early in the stacking process allows it to fail fast when
incompatible configuration is detected.

Call this function in a new section of stack.sh, 'Validate Configuration',
directly after the 'Configure Projects' section.

Also, fix a typo in lib/neutron_thirdparty/bigswitch_floodlight

Change-Id: Icf58b6bec0f1f31320b4e126d6e27a047e31da74
Closes-Bug: #1386267
"}]
commit_message:
Create validate step for Neutron third-party programs

Add a new function to lib/neutron that can be implemented by scripts under
lib/neutron_thirdparty to validate that the current configuration
is compatible with the third-party program. This can be used, for example, to
ensure that enabled services do not conflict with the third-party program
and that pre-requisite services are enabled. Adding a validate step
relatively early in the stacking process allows it to fail fast when
incompatible configuration is detected.

Call this function in a new section of stack.sh, 'Validate Configuration',
directly after the 'Configure Projects' section.

Also, fix a typo in lib/neutron_thirdparty/bigswitch_floodlight

Change-Id: Icf58b6bec0f1f31320b4e126d6e27a047e31da74
Closes-Bug: #1386267

revisions:

A recent commit (I29c73355a85112840b57f93b39a9eeda421875e6) updated the
epel element to rely on wget, but wget is not always installed. Since
wget is used in pre-install.d, we must install it in that phase.

Change-Id: Iad2a9c4f0081835a1aa78e6fd2f721f6afd44dc2
'}]
commit_message:
Add wget to package-installs.yaml for epel

A recent commit (I29c73355a85112840b57f93b39a9eeda421875e6) updated the
epel element to rely on wget, but wget is not always installed. Since
wget is used in pre-install.d, we must install it in that phase.

Change-Id: Iad2a9c4f0081835a1aa78e6fd2f721f6afd44dc2

commit_message:
Do not allow the use of slash in the project name

To get a scoped token using the project name, we will need
to inform the full hierarchy path. For that, we will use the '/'
character as a delimiter between the projects, so for this point,
we will not allow the use of slash in the project name.

This patch is part from the Reseller spec.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte Sousa <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Partially-Implements: bp reseller

Change-Id: Ic86f8f9da69b8d97e78271a4d7373c83ea28689e

subject: Fix odd formats in api-microversions spec
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-26 00:47:31.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/api-microversions.rst'], 'message': 'Fix odd formats in api-microversions spec

"::" of previous "For example" exists already, and the next "::" makes
meaningless "::" in a html document. In addition, there are many ">"s
before sample code even if these code appears as literal blocks.
This patch removes them for the readability.

Change-Id: I0a4042247e0481b4ef7c374792a5b9e9c4d2eb09
'}]
commit_message:
Fix odd formats in api-microversions spec

"::" of previous "For example" exists already, and the next "::" makes
meaningless "::" in a html document. In addition, there are many ">"s
before sample code even if these code appears as literal blocks.
This patch removes them for the readability.

Change-Id: I0a4042247e0481b4ef7c374792a5b9e9c4d2eb09

subject: Change order of grub2 check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-18 22:12:39.000000000', 'files': ['elements/vm/finalise.d/51-bootloader'], 'message': 'Change order of grub2 check

The vm element needs to check if this is a grub 1.99 system
BEFORE it attempts to do an offline installation of grub2. In the
current state, this errors out with `No package grub2 available.`

Change-Id: I6dfd0868e51ae70ac580442923c30341caa9ae16
'}]
commit_message:
Change order of grub2 check

The vm element needs to check if this is a grub 1.99 system
BEFORE it attempts to do an offline installation of grub2. In the
current state, this errors out with `No package grub2 available.`

Change-Id: I6dfd0868e51ae70ac580442923c30341caa9ae16

requirements limits set to older version of OpenStack, so let's remove
these jobs.

commit_message:
Remove discover from test requirements

The package is used to provide new unittest module features for python
installations older than 2.7. Since we don't support py26 target
anymore, the dependency is safe to kill.

Change-Id: Icb238d577d0dd30e091bdb65dcec5f695749dc7b

revisions:

In order to support compatibility between functools.wraps
in version 2 and 3 (3.4 or later) functools.wraps was replaced
by six.wraps. The behaviour of sixdecorator is exaclty the same
but it also supports __wrapped__ attribute according to

Change-Id: Ib695629e69e517206e630fff026c08b7847402dc

commit_message:
Add 2to3 compatibility for functools.wraps

In order to support compatibility between functools.wraps
in version 2 and 3 (3.4 or later) functools.wraps was replaced
by six.wraps. The behaviour of sixdecorator is exaclty the same
but it also supports __wrapped__ attribute according to
3.4 specs.

Change-Id: Ib695629e69e517206e630fff026c08b7847402dc

commit_message:
Prepare for Services in virtual env

* Build a wheel cache for the target environment
* Change the target ervice etups to use the new virtual-env
  interface stack_service_install(): keystone, glance, cinder, nova,
  swift, ironic, ceilometer

subject: Use neutron's api job to validate func job change

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 19:27:03.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/neutron-api.yaml'], 'message': "Use neutron's api job to validate func job change

A recent commit to devstack-gate added support for limiting the repos
that are updated for a node by overriding the PROJECTS variable.  This
change temporarily repurposes neutron's api job to check that setting
this override is compatible with the functional job.  The api job is
currently non-voting, so no patches will be harmed in the process.

Change-Id: I7591569d3f039eeebed859333b29dd63104cd389
"}]
commit_message:
Use neutron's api job to validate func job change

A recent commit to devstack-gate added support for limiting the repos
that are updated for a node by overriding the PROJECTS variable.  This
change temporarily repurposes neutron's api job to check that setting
this override is compatible with the functional job.  The api job is
currently non-voting, so no patches will be harmed in the process.

Change-Id: I7591569d3f039eeebed859333b29dd63104cd389

subject: Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-26 15:30:53.000000000', 'files': ['etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg'], 'message': 'Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config,
the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the
172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist
anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if
some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of
the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the
interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least
as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern
Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza
with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255
'}]
commit_message:
Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config,
the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the
172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist
anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if
some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of
the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the
interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least
as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern
Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza
with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255

commit_message:
Only use public_endpoint when specified

Default public_endpoint in keystone.conf to not be set, unless
specified. By default this value isn't required.

Change-Id: I5f5c213ef639f548b80080c5c5338db610b0b7f8
Closes-Bug: #1421048

commit_message:
Add iRMC Management module for iRMC Driver

This module inherits ipmitool.IPMIManagement and overrides the
following two functions for iRMC Drivers in order to make use of iRMC
IPMI boot mode get/set capability and SCCI get sensor data.

* set_boot_device()
* get_sensors_data()

Implements: blueprint irmc-management-driver
Change-Id: I8dd6e76a7e85eb477dcde11e322fa1e308fe968c

For live migration we are starting to use the i386 arch based images and
don't want to cache them like all other images.

commit_message:
List all CIRROS ARCH images in image_list.sh

image_list.sh is used to make a list of all possible images. Loop over
both x86_64 and i386 instead of just using the default arch of x86_64

For live migration we are starting to use the i386 arch based images and
don't want to cache them like all other images.

Change-Id: I47da72a0e9da3689cb085bb43ac6536094445112

Adds cleaning states to the state machine and implements _do_node_clean

commit_message:
Implement Cleaning States

Adds cleaning states to the state machine and implements _do_node_clean
in the conductor. Changes DELETING->AVAILABLE and MANAGEABLE->AVAILABLE
transitions to always go through the cleaning process. Cleaning can
be disabled with a config option added in a later patch to maintain
the same functionality as in Juno had with ACTIVE->DELETING->NOSTATE.

Implements blueprint implement-cleaning-states
Change-Id: Ie968e5b3d45f417e98da6b3d985de5bfd851c364

set: OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=60. However, this variable isn't used, and

commit_message:
Remove unused OS_TEST_TIMEOUT variable

When running the unit tests, this environment variable was being
set: OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=60. However, this variable isn't used, and
there doesn't seem to be a need to use it, so it is removed here.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-18 15:19:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/numa_topology_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_numa_topology_filters.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Set instance NUMA topology on HostState

NUMATopologyFilter will try to fit an instance onto every host
(represented by a HostState instance) so assigning the resulting
instance topology to the instance dict really makes no sense, as we end
up with only the last calculated topology from all the filter runs.

This in turn makes consume_from_instance not work as expected, as it
will consume NUMA topology calculated from the last host the filter was
run on, not the host that was chosen by the scheduler.

This patch stashes the calculated NUMA topology onto the HostState
instance passed to the filter, that will be used in
consume_from_instance, and makes sure that is what gets used for
updating the usage.

Change-Id: Ifacccadf73dc114e50f46b8e6087ffb2b2fc9d6b
Closes-Bug: #1405359
'}]
commit_message:
Set instance NUMA topology on HostState

NUMATopologyFilter will try to fit an instance onto every host
(represented by a HostState instance) so assigning the resulting
instance topology to the instance dict really makes no sense, as we end
up with only the last calculated topology from all the filter runs.

This in turn makes consume_from_instance not work as expected, as it
will consume NUMA topology calculated from the last host the filter was
run on, not the host that was chosen by the scheduler.

This patch stashes the calculated NUMA topology onto the HostState
instance passed to the filter, that will be used in
consume_from_instance, and makes sure that is what gets used for
updating the usage.

Change-Id: Ifacccadf73dc114e50f46b8e6087ffb2b2fc9d6b
Closes-Bug: #1405359

commit_message:
VPNaaS refactor service driver to reuse VpnDriver code

Introduce BaseIPsecVpnDriver class to host most of the
common code to be shared across various implementations
of VPN service-drivers. This reduces the duplicate code
in these service-drivers

Closes-Bug: #1422905
Related-Bug: #1423244
Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <numan.siddique@enovance.com>
Change-Id: Ibde249af5c7228e2f9b7496cb03bd9b516966ef5

subject: Change L3 agent AdvancedService class to be non-singleton
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}, {'_account_id': 8344, 'name': 'fumihiko kakuma', 'email': 'kakuma@valinux.co.jp', 'username': 'kakuma'}, {'_account_id': 8873, 'name': 'Assaf Muller', 'email': 'amuller@redhat.com', 'username': 'amuller'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10387, 'name': 'Freescale CI', 'email': 'fslosci@freescale.com', 'username': 'freescale-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-26 00:07:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/test_firewall_service.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/firewall_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "Change L3 agent AdvancedService class to be non-singleton

The idea behind the AdvancedServices (Metadata, *aaS) services
to be singletons was to (1) offer a way to get an instance of such
a service in a convinient manner, and to (2) ensure that only one
service registered per service type.

(1) Since the AdvancedService.instance method required an instance
of a L3 agent, this point was kind of missed. If you have a L3 agent
instance in your hand, just use it to access the service you're looking
for.

(2) This is now fulfilled by asserting that only one driver is registered
(per type) in the .add method.

The motivation to make them non-singletons is that:
a) They don't need to be
b) The code is simplified this way
c) I've been facing crazy issues during functional testing where we're
   constantly instantiating L3 agents, and the (singleton) metadata
   service was referencing the wrong configuration object. The service
   was re-initialized during a test, screwing up the configuration of
   other mid-run tests.

Related-Bug: #1425759
Change-Id: I155aece9b7028f1bdd3d9709facef392b38aec27
"}]
commit_message:
Change L3 agent AdvancedService class to be non-singleton

The idea behind the AdvancedServices (Metadata, *aaS) services
to be singletons was to (1) offer a way to get an instance of such
a service in a convinient manner, and to (2) ensure that only one
service registered per service type.

(1) Since the AdvancedService.instance method required an instance
of a L3 agent, this point was kind of missed. If you have a L3 agent
instance in your hand, just use it to access the service you're looking
for.

(2) This is now fulfilled by asserting that only one driver is registered
(per type) in the .add method.

The motivation to make them non-singletons is that:
a) They don't need to be
b) The code is simplified this way
c) I've been facing crazy issues during functional testing where we're
   constantly instantiating L3 agents, and the (singleton) metadata
   service was referencing the wrong configuration object. The service
   was re-initialized during a test, screwing up the configuration of
   other mid-run tests.

Related-Bug: #1425759
Change-Id: I155aece9b7028f1bdd3d9709facef392b38aec27

commit_message:
Add localboot support for iscsi_ilo driver

This adds localboot support for iscsi_ilo driver
by enabling it to recognise boot_option in
it's vendor passthru and set boot device to disk.

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: I55ddacb010376d3045ea6fa68d82ef5aa5a57db4

commit_message:
Change L3 agent AdvancedService class to be non-singleton

The idea behind the AdvancedServices (Metadata, *aaS) services
to be singletons was to (1) offer a way to get an instance of such
a service in a convinient manner, and to (2) ensure that only one
service registered per service type.

(1) Since the AdvancedService.instance method required an instance
of a L3 agent, this point was kind of missed. If you have a L3 agent
instance in your hand, just use it to access the service you're looking
for.

(2) This is now fulfilled by asserting that only one driver is registered
(per type) in the .add method.

The motivation to make them non-singletons is that:
a) They don't need to be
b) The code is simplified this way
c) I've been facing crazy issues during functional testing where we're
   constantly instantiating L3 agents, and the (singleton) metadata
   service was referencing the wrong configuration object. The service
   was re-initialized during a test, screwing up the configuration of
   other mid-run tests.

Related-Bug: #1425759
Change-Id: I199f6a967c64e921624b397fa5b7dfc56572d63a

commit_message:
Adds line ranges, DRYs code, fixes #nosec

This adds line ranges instead of just the line the warning starts on. Shuffle
some code around into methods so we can DRY up the code. Since we now have line
ranges, the #nosec flag can be found accross lines so it's no longer required
that #nosec be on the line that warning starts.

Change-Id: Id63cf0fa5d9882eec7c6d388054bc678fb6e0457

commit_message:
Add check for secret=True on oslo password options

Anywhere oslo.config is used to register an option for a password,
Bandit needs to check whether its marked secret.

https://github.com/hyakuhei/OSSG-Security-Practices/blob/master/sensitive_config_file_options.md

Change-Id: I77ed0d50e004c41a685dac5c647b2129de8bc198

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-25 07:50:49.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/puppet/parser/functions/echo.rb'], 'message': 'Add echo function

Is intended to be used for debugging like this:

echo($a, 'My string')
$b = [1,2,3]
echo($b, 'My array')
> 2015/02/10 21:43:26.939: My string (String) "test"

Like 'notice' function but better

Change-Id: I0efb98a34b8d955c0703719c534c9dff912dcee9
'}]
commit_message:
Add echo function

Is intended to be used for debugging like this:
$a = 'test'
echo($a, 'My string')
$b = [1,2,3]
echo($b, 'My array')
> 2015/02/10 21:43:26.939: My string (String) "test"

subject: Allow to call initialize_app when running --help
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-24 20:44:43.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/app.py', 'cliff/tests/test_app.py'], 'message': "Allow to call initialize_app when running --help

Currently initialize_app is not called when running --help. Some
applications (like openstackclient) define its sub-commands in
initialize_app. So sub-commands are hidden when running '--help' except
if applications hack cliff to defer help print (openstackclient case).

This change defines a new option to allow deferring help print after
initialize_app. Openstackclient will be updated in a follow-up change
in order to remove previous hack.

Change-Id: I0c6fb93d5713654b180b4488e85118c1818fdfb0
Closes-Bug: #1316622
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to call initialize_app when running --help

Currently initialize_app is not called when running --help. Some
applications (like openstackclient) define its sub-commands in
initialize_app. So sub-commands are hidden when running '--help' except
if applications hack cliff to defer help print (openstackclient case).

This change defines a new option to allow deferring help print after
initialize_app. Openstackclient will be updated in a follow-up change
in order to remove previous hack.

Change-Id: I0c6fb93d5713654b180b4488e85118c1818fdfb0
Closes-Bug: #1316622

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 7575, 'name': 'Sabari', 'email': 'smurugesan@vmware.com', 'username': 'sabari'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-26 03:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_vmware_store.py', 'glance_store/tests/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix sorting query string keys for arbitrary url schemes

In Python2.6, urlparse module does not parse the query string from
from the url for arbitrary schemes. http://bugs.python.org/issue9374

Thus, our test utility method does not sort the qs keys for vmware
store url scheme (which is vsphere). This causes random failures in
py26 unit tests.

Change-Id: I1f5da01bfb346b547c1f70b7de9b18585c197f29
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sorting query string keys for arbitrary url schemes

In Python2.6, urlparse module does not parse the query string from
from the url for arbitrary schemes. http://bugs.python.org/issue9374

Thus, our test utility method does not sort the qs keys for vmware
store url scheme (which is vsphere). This causes random failures in
py26 unit tests.

Change-Id: I1f5da01bfb346b547c1f70b7de9b18585c197f29

commit_message:
Update policy check on hypervisors V3 API & DB layer

Remove db layer admin authorization for compute node and let
the admin to decide the policy setting.
Split the v3 API hypervisors authorization according to their actions
and add test cases for the policy check.

Change-Id: I7d05550f96c2e632e86eff4938ce7461b4964ef4
Implements: blueprint v3-api-policy

subject: Use oslo.config.cfg.CONF with oslo.config generator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-04 22:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/opts.py'], 'message': "Use oslo.config.cfg.CONF with oslo.config generator

This is a proof-of-concept (hack) that uses the global
oslo.config.cfg.CONF to get the list of config options,
to be used by oslo.config's generator -- to generate
our ironic.config.sample file.

There are two other patches/ways proposed for using
oslo.config's generator:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/128005/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/137447/

This one is based off of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/128005/.
It generated more options that the one it was based off of; I haven't
done a detailed look, but this looks more complete.

Change-Id: Ic5e6dc9a0070090cfe20f4b94051fa5fde82c175
"}]
commit_message:
Use oslo.config.cfg.CONF with oslo.config generator

This is a proof-of-concept (hack) that uses the global
oslo.config.cfg.CONF to get the list of config options,
to be used by oslo.config's generator -- to generate
our ironic.config.sample file.

There are two other patches/ways proposed for using
oslo.config's generator:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/128005/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/137447/

This one is based off of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/128005/.
It generated more options that the one it was based off of; I haven't
done a detailed look, but this looks more complete.

Change-Id: Ic5e6dc9a0070090cfe20f4b94051fa5fde82c175

commit_message:
VMware NSXv: Added router-type to database model

NSXv supports 'exclusive' and 'shared' router types, this patch adds
support for different router types to the plugin database model.
This doesn't add an additional migration script,
but overrides the existing one, adding a migration script isn't needed
since the plugin is still under development.

Change-Id: I05a595e5e12c8384612e0cc6eb0abc8e72ce3dc0
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@vmware.com>

commit_message:
Run tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs job on ubuntu

This patch ensures that the job "tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs" to
run on ubuntu instead of centos.

And this patch also adds tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs job as a
experimental job to stackforge/devstack-plugin-glusterfs project.

To remove the conductor proxying that compute manager currently uses
for making calls to notify_usage_exists(), a final remaining db call
in notifications have to be converted to objects.

This change converts the remaining call to db.bw_usage_get_by_uuids()
to call the object method BandwidthUsageList.get_by_uuids() instead.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I1c84edac57eb101bcffba790536fbb195185ff31
'}]
commit_message:
Make notifications use BandwidthUsageList object

To remove the conductor proxying that compute manager currently uses
for making calls to notify_usage_exists(), a final remaining db call
in notifications have to be converted to objects.

This change converts the remaining call to db.bw_usage_get_by_uuids()
to call the object method BandwidthUsageList.get_by_uuids() instead.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I1c84edac57eb101bcffba790536fbb195185ff31

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-02-25 19:14:06.000000000', 'files': ['utils/configuration_validator/test_configuration.py', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/cluster/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-haproxy/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/deployment_groups/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/astute/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/vmware/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/cluster-haproxy/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/virtual_ips/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-controller/tasks.yaml'], 'message': 'Make one joined graph from 3 separate stages

Previously this 3 stages was disjoined and connected programatically
during traversal in nailgun. Such approach imposes some dificulties
during traversal and filtering and not really extandable (add new stages).

Introduced change allows us to simplify traversal logic, and therefore
improve UX for tasks developer

Also in such approach it is quite easy to introduce new stages, like
something that should be executed after cluster is completed, for example,
stage end_notification that should fire some messages when we can guarantee
that cluster is completed.
Or add stage provision to the same graph.

related to blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks
Depends on nailgun: Ida5880525f9c3428ad8bb590f7ef78a0b20b1049

Change-Id: Ie332d0c1745a48c5ae96c4c80d94922c321d5f7a
'}]
commit_message:
Make one joined graph from 3 separate stages

Previously this 3 stages was disjoined and connected programatically
during traversal in nailgun. Such approach imposes some dificulties
during traversal and filtering and not really extandable (add new stages).

Introduced change allows us to simplify traversal logic, and therefore
improve UX for tasks developer

Also in such approach it is quite easy to introduce new stages, like
something that should be executed after cluster is completed, for example,
stage end_notification that should fire some messages when we can guarantee
that cluster is completed.
Or add stage provision to the same graph.

related to blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks
Depends on nailgun: Ida5880525f9c3428ad8bb590f7ef78a0b20b1049

Change-Id: Ie332d0c1745a48c5ae96c4c80d94922c321d5f7a

commit_message:
Patch timeutils from oslo_utils

The new version of oslo.db uses oslo_utils.timeutils to fill the
`updated_at` column and similar ones, so we should mock timeutils from
oslo_utils - not from oslo.utils - in tests to mock these values
properly.

Change-Id: I9931d6bc236bd84896164e9656eee2d06700d9d9

Change-Id: Ife05b7291b48f1df7d4a08c4ef960fc9dbc24025
Implements: blueprint inband-properties-discovery
'}]
commit_message:
Add lift_lock context manager to TaskManager

This is for ironic-discoverd driver to be able to temporary life lock
when calling into discoverd. Otherwise there will be a deadlock
between driver still holding a lock and ironic-discoverd trying
to manipulate a node.

Change-Id: Ife05b7291b48f1df7d4a08c4ef960fc9dbc24025
Implements: blueprint inband-properties-discovery

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-26 14:02:32.000000000', 'files': ['shade/meta.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Make image processing work for v2

It turns out, not only is image _uploading_ different for v1 and v2,
image metadata processing is completely different too. And, Rackspace
disallows image properties with certain prefixes, the task checking loop
can fail some times. Also, glance v2 warlock objects work differently.

Change-Id: I37ac719270bde259ab1cf59763d3b949990bf497
'}]
commit_message:
Make image processing work for v2

It turns out, not only is image _uploading_ different for v1 and v2,
image metadata processing is completely different too. And, Rackspace
disallows image properties with certain prefixes, the task checking loop
can fail some times. Also, glance v2 warlock objects work differently.

Change-Id: I37ac719270bde259ab1cf59763d3b949990bf497

commit_message:
Remove a redundant existence check in resource PATCH

The code has already verified the resource exists, prior to
checking the body for length, so we only need to return if the body
length is 0, nothing else.

Change-Id: Id000b5e8f3a965701b682236bcb9f0bae3bcaa4b

A recent refactoring left out the configurability of novnc listen host
and port. In this patch override the host and port and clear the conf
object before calling baseproxy. The clearing of the conf object will
allow further processing of config files downstream.

Change-Id: I31a3869f7ead177d8885e98f2e0a1031f3091384
Closes-Bug: 1425178
'}]
commit_message:
Allows configuring of novnc bind interface and port

A recent refactoring left out the configurability of novnc listen host
and port. In this patch override the host and port and clear the conf
object before calling baseproxy. The clearing of the conf object will
allow further processing of config files downstream.

Change-Id: I31a3869f7ead177d8885e98f2e0a1031f3091384
Closes-Bug: 1425178

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2014-09-10 17:54:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/fake.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': 'vc driver breaks instances.hypervisor_hostname value

In the nova "instances" table, Vmware VC driver creates
the same hypervisor_hostname "domain-c26(Cluster1)"
when two vcenters are configured with same cluster
name "Cluster1". This issues became the root
cause for the defect 1329261. To fix this issue,
VC driver is updated to create the node name with
vcenter UUID, which will be unique by default.

Closes-bug: #1329261
Change-Id: Iff37fc19b2a6b64a830ae0ed5e4c7f7a00edf0b0
'}]
commit_message:
vc driver breaks instances.hypervisor_hostname value

In the nova "instances" table, Vmware VC driver creates
the same hypervisor_hostname "domain-c26(Cluster1)"
when two vcenters are configured with same cluster
name "Cluster1". This issues became the root
cause for the defect 1329261. To fix this issue,
VC driver is updated to create the node name with
vcenter UUID, which will be unique by default.

Closes-bug: #1329261
Change-Id: Iff37fc19b2a6b64a830ae0ed5e4c7f7a00edf0b0

commit_message:
Introduce heat-templates for coreos.

Below are the changes added.
    1. Added heat-templates for coreos(micro OS).
    2. Implemented code to parameterize the token & ssh_authorized_key.
    3. Added ssh_authorized_key to the baymodel.
    4. Added test cases.
    5. Removed white spaces.
    6. Added apache license.

subject: Utilize dogpile.cache for caching
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-26 00:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Utilize dogpile.cache for caching

In the future we can make the backend more configurable which will help
users build more powerful things on top of shade with better caching
available to them.

Shade is caching elements like images, volumes and flavors
that are subject to change (flavor the less of them). Storing
items in a cache makes that changes to elements, like adding
or deleting, or changes of status, are not perceived by the
cache. However, the cache is still needed to improve performance
when several concurrent calls are done.

Change-Id: If072bcdbdaa2b0a021e26b1ea2211b1dfcc75880
Co-Authored-By: Clint Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Utilize dogpile.cache for caching

In the future we can make the backend more configurable which will help
users build more powerful things on top of shade with better caching
available to them.

Shade is caching elements like images, volumes and flavors
that are subject to change (flavor the less of them). Storing
items in a cache makes that changes to elements, like adding
or deleting, or changes of status, are not perceived by the
cache. However, the cache is still needed to improve performance
when several concurrent calls are done.

Change-Id: If072bcdbdaa2b0a021e26b1ea2211b1dfcc75880
Co-Authored-By: Clint Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>

commit_message:
Stop sending gratuitous arp when ip version is 6

IPv6 uses NDP instead of ARP. This fix uses ping6 to trigger
neighbor discovery when router interface or gateway is added
and subnet ip version is 6.

Change-Id: I8374391afafb579d6353df973e9f397afb94963a
Closes-Bug: 1357068

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint rabbit-container-set

This patch provides an initial implementation of docker-compose
(i.e. fig). docker-compose runs in a container. The container is
only instantiated when invoked to manage a container set
(i.e. docker-compose up) and then stopped when the command is
finished executing.

Change-Id: I797f06bed773192129b57aae9824d4f97c70b3ab

commit_message:
Closes-Bug: 1425631

Kolla containers obtain time from the host they run on.
Therefore, it is important that hosts (virtual hosts in the case
of the heat template) maintain proper time. NTP should be used
for this purpose.

Change-Id: Ieaf272c79884fb8b5e655ba52d8cc72467a9c831

commit_message:
Update `os service create` examples in config services

OSC was updated to make type a mandatory field, and a service name
made optional. Though the current examples still work, OSC will
deprecate the supported syntax eventually. Update the docs now
before I forget to do it later.

Change-Id: I56f3e3e8601b2df488e8a45015a53f184d107b3a
Related-Bug: #1404073

subject: Change traversal ID from Integer to UUID
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 23:00:09.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/convergence-graph-progress.rst', 'specs/kilo/convergence-prepare-traversal.rst', 'specs/kilo/convergence-stack-data.rst'], 'message': "Change traversal ID from Integer to UUID

We can't rely on an incrementing traversal ID, because multiple updates may
be simultaneously creating (before the race) or deleting (after losing the
race) rows in the SyncPoint table, and the only protection they have from
each other is having a unique primary key - which is a combination of the
resource ID and the traversal ID.

We don't rely on the traversal ID to infer the order of past traversals, so
it is safe to use a UUID here instead.

This change is prototyped in
https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/commit/179cb5b071cbc0763071155a80e3bdb0b5d62a2e

Change-Id: I64bd1bee893e733eb9498efc649e2932bdc2b58b
"}]
commit_message:
Change traversal ID from Integer to UUID

We can't rely on an incrementing traversal ID, because multiple updates may
be simultaneously creating (before the race) or deleting (after losing the
race) rows in the SyncPoint table, and the only protection they have from
each other is having a unique primary key - which is a combination of the
resource ID and the traversal ID.

We don't rely on the traversal ID to infer the order of past traversals, so
it is safe to use a UUID here instead.

This change is prototyped in
https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/commit/179cb5b071cbc0763071155a80e3bdb0b5d62a2e

Change-Id: I64bd1bee893e733eb9498efc649e2932bdc2b58b

commit_message:
Add python-pbr as a build-requirement

Since both python-fuelclient and fuel-agent use pbr
for performing build-related tasks it's essential to
have it on build-stage when building RPMs.

Closes-bug: #1424185

commit_message:
Delete `row` class in _detail_overview.html

As we can see the screenshots from the bug link, the `row`
class will cause that the content in them overflows, the
patch fix it.

Closes-Bug: 1417603
Change-Id: I58391214e7250f8c08ffc8a7ba7a2411ff756a5e

commit_message:
Switch nova.network.* to use instance dot notation

nova.network.* should use instance objects with the
field access dot notation everywhere. Essentially we use
instance.key instead of instance['key']. Needed to rework
some of the test cases to get them working. This changeset
depends on Id002b1ba3f2c7f8af880d72043aebc5219280342

Change-Id: I64edb5f20c2b46c8e3375e21f8d5caeef6b3717a

commit_message:
modify task table to use string for types

All DB modification is done by a migration script
* remove task type and data type table from DB
* change type_id to type (and use a string description)
* change data_type_id to data_type (and use a string description)

Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
Fixes MNP-33

Change-Id: Ic397afcdf9804a011a296a6f3e8bf4f3ce446c94

commit_message:
Revert : Switch off oslo.* namespace check temporarily

In I7033847bab82b6d3cd8f2bdb66c553fec93d7acb, we disabled
N333 to allow changes in flight to still mix up oslo_ and
oslo. based imports. We should revert the change and enforce
every review use just the oslo_ version from now on.

Change-Id: I1db83048c569bcdd62538cce9df076fc355f7b26

commit_message:
Ensure openstack client output is cleaned of stderr

We suck at parsing openstack output when it's both stderr and stdout
combined with all the Warnings we get and might get in future.

Change-Id: Ifc2743952d653edf8da918f11494d8277f8507d5

commit_message:
Disable swift in tempest for icehouse

We don't deploy swift in icehouse so tempest tests are not going to
work.

commit_message:
Add Member form's "Member Address" field - Required asterisk missing

While adding a new member to the pool, under Load Balancers, the form
contains a field 'Member Address'. This field is mandatory and should
be marked with asterisk.

Change-Id: I777878833d5a6921d9c39880739dfab9e51f4bff
Closes-Bug: #1392182

subject: Fixing a regex bug in version_tag
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-25 17:06:28.000000000', 'files': ['package.sh'], 'message': "Fixing a regex bug in version_tag

version tag for unstable builds assumed that the last tag returned by:
`get describe --tags` always returned a {version}.rcX tag value. This
can not be true for maintain versions, where the version released is not
'rc' anymore. Change the regex to make the 'rc' part optional.

Furthermore, if the commit is not the tag by itself, will print out the
tag name, a hyphen, the number of commits made, a hyphen, the letter ‘g’
and then the commit identifier. This way:

    `2014.2+1.0-6-gc1433d2`

add the `6-gc1433d2` part to the regex.

Change-Id: I1f6fae6a00e0d5aef7a0d42ada70145d34bcf4e3
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing a regex bug in version_tag

version tag for unstable builds assumed that the last tag returned by:
`get describe --tags` always returned a {version}.rcX tag value. This
can not be true for maintain versions, where the version released is not
'rc' anymore. Change the regex to make the 'rc' part optional.

Furthermore, if the commit is not the tag by itself, will print out the
tag name, a hyphen, the number of commits made, a hyphen, the letter ‘g’
and then the commit identifier. This way:

    `2014.2+1.0-6-gc1433d2`

add the `6-gc1433d2` part to the regex.

Change-Id: I1f6fae6a00e0d5aef7a0d42ada70145d34bcf4e3

subject: Fixes agent call may hanged upon action call
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-26 08:01:56.000000000', 'files': ['murano/common/engine.py', 'murano/engine/system/agent.py', 'meta/io.murano/Classes/Environment.yaml', 'murano/engine/system/agent_listener.py', 'murano/engine/environment.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fixes agent call may hanged upon action call

When action called AgentListener automatically starts listening upon
first EP send to the agent. But Environment.deploy() were the only
place where AgentLister was stopped. So when action other than
Environment.deploy() was called there is no one to stop listener.
Thus on each action call new listener on the same RabbitMQ queue
was started causing listeners to steal messages from each other.
Agent.call() that never received response from agent caused
deployment/action hang

Change-Id: I466bbf60c35e0d6a0bc6e831010e552aaa12eaab
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes agent call may hanged upon action call

When action called AgentListener automatically starts listening upon
first EP send to the agent. But Environment.deploy() were the only
place where AgentLister was stopped. So when action other than
Environment.deploy() was called there is no one to stop listener.
Thus on each action call new listener on the same RabbitMQ queue
was started causing listeners to steal messages from each other.
Agent.call() that never received response from agent caused
deployment/action hang

Change-Id: I466bbf60c35e0d6a0bc6e831010e552aaa12eaab

commit_message:
Use oslo_config generator

Stop using the custom script to generate the sample configuration file
and use the oslo-config-generator function of oslo_config.

The change modified "genconfigs" function as a tox testenv (-egenconfigs),
to depend the on oslo-config-generator function of oslo_config.

Co-Authored-By: Ghe Rivero <ghe.rivero@hp.com>
Closes-Bug: #1384318
Change-Id: I4c1889c97a335d1dbcc70bca6affe985680e9ab7

commit_message:
Improve logging to debug invalid "extra_specs" entries

When volume creation failes due to invalid extra_specs entry, its hard
to find a mismatch between extra_specs and capabilities exposed by
multiple hosts. This additional log printings will help to detect a root
cause of the failure.

Change-Id: I1831ddfd5bcc5db7d7412838d584412184ecbd84

commit_message:
Rename a couple of scripts to avoid duplicated names

In recent versions, diskimage-builder aborts when two elements have
scripts in the same hook with the same filename. Since hive and oozie
are usually used/required by the element of a plugin, there will be at
least 2 or 3 root.d scripts named 0-check.

Give unique names to the hive and oozie scripts.

Change-Id: Ia85508615de4271dfc1de913b7eff2d36392c008
Closes-Bug: #1424715
